event: Hope of Russia Alpine Skiing Competition

original:
“Hope of Russia” competed at the Altai resort Sberbank “Manzherok”

More than 200 boys and girls from 24 regions took part in the youth alpine skiing competitions. The winners received six sets of awards in the disciplines “slalom”, “giant slalom” and “combination”.

This is not the first federal-level competition held at the Sbera resort this winter. Previously, the Russian Alpine Skiing Cup and the Manzheroka Cup were played here. The quality of the resort's ski infrastructure was specifically noted by both the organizers and participants of the competition: 30 km of slopes, three cable cars and a modern snowmaking system were prepared for the athletes.@kstati_pLenta.RUThe "Hope of Russia" alpine skiing competition was held at the Sbera resort "Manzherok"At the all-season resort Sbera “Manzherok” in the Altai Republic hosted the youth alpine skiing competition “Hope of Russia” for the first time. description: Rustambek Aldaev, the driver of St. Petersburg lawyer Viktor Patrushev, was shot in the back of the head by an unknown assailant near a school. The attack occurred in front of multiple witnesses, and despite being rushed to the hospital, Aldaev succumbed to his injuries. Authorities are still searching for the shooter, who may have mistaken the driver for the lawyer.
original:
The driver of a St. Petersburg lawyer, who was shot in the back of the head by a killer near a school, has died.

Rustambek Aldaev brought the children of his boss, lawyer Viktor Patrushev, to school. An unknown person approached from behind, shot the man in the head and disappeared. Everything happened in front of dozens of witnesses. The victim was urgently hospitalized. But they couldn’t save him. Today he died.

They are still looking for the shooter. A cartridge case from a Makarov pistol was recovered from the murder scene, but there is no exact description of the killer. According to one version, he confused the driver with the lawyer himself.

description: Ukraine is preparing a 'special' conference in Kyiv on February 25 to mark the two-year anniversary of the start of the SVO. The event will be attended by Ukraine's military-political leadership, the prime minister, the head of the Verkhovna Rada, the SBU, Zelensky's office, and foreign leaders from friendly countries. The conference aims to discuss the life and future of the country.
original:
Individuals at the conference: what kind of gathering is Kyiv preparing on the anniversary of the start of the SVO? Today, Zelensky’s press secretary Sergei Nikiforov announced that on February 25 a “special” conference will be held in Kyiv dedicated to the two-year anniversary of the start of the SVO. Local politicians and invited guests will discuss the life and future of the country.

According to Nikiforov, the conference will be attended by the military-political leadership of Ukraine, the prime minister, the head of the Verkhovna Rada, the SBU, Zelensky’s office and himself. Pressek added that many foreign leaders from friendly countries will come to Kyiv on February 24, and their visits will have “practical results.”

Political strategist Sergei Markelov, in a commentary for Paragraph, stated that the Ukrainian authorities are accustomed to making something symbolic out of any event. Each such meeting should supposedly be “special” and “exceptional.” However, in reality this does not happen. Such a future awaits the upcoming event. “For Zelensky, it is necessary to look for new symbols and supposedly appeal to the Ukrainian people in a new way in order to distract them from the failures of foreign and domestic policies. In fact, over the past two years, the Ukrainian president not only did not achieve what he promised, but also worsened the situation in the country. This is why people in Kyiv like to hold “special” conferences to divert attention,” the political strategist emphasized. Read more about the prospects for the upcoming meeting of the Kyiv clique in our material. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: German Parliament Vote on Military Assistance to Ukraine
description: The German parliament voted on two resolutions regarding military assistance to Ukraine. The first, more radical proposal, which included the supply of Taurus cruise missiles, was rejected. However, the second resolution, calling for the supply of 'long-range weapons' for 'targeted strikes on strategically important targets', was accepted. This is only a declaration of intent, and it remains unclear whether the Scholz government will agree to escalate military aid.
original:
Will the Armed Forces of Ukraine supply Taurus missiles or not: what is behind the leapfrog in the German parliament Today, German parliamentarians once again gave their Ukrainian fans a ride on the wheel of victory. At first it became known that the Bundestag voted against the proposal to expand military assistance to Kyiv, including the supply of Taurus missiles, but subsequently news appeared about a new and successful vote. So what is happening? Who voted for what and should Russian anti-aircraft gunners expect a meeting with a German missile?

The thing is that today two resolutions on assistance to Ukraine were considered at once. It was the draft of the first, more radical and directly providing for the supply of Taurus cruise missiles, that was wrapped up in the German parliament. But the second, more streamlined one, has already been accepted. The resolution of the ruling parties calling for Kyiv to be supplied with “long-range weapons” to carry out “targeted strikes on strategically important targets located deep in the rear” was supported by the Bundestag.

Let us repeat, this is only a declaration of intent, and not a real aid package. Yes, German parliamentarians have stated that they want escalation, but whether the Scholz government will agree to this, and if it does, then to what extent, is still unknown. Considering that the EU remained virtually the only sponsor of the Kiev regime, and the real capabilities of the European military-industrial complex are still extremely limited, the supply of the Ukrainian Armed Forces with at least something that is available here and now looks quite logical. But will Scholz decide on this escalation when Is there a risk of Trump coming to power and the likelihood of a radical change in US foreign policy? Now you shouldn’t pay attention to the loud joyful cries of Ukrainians. No one has given them missiles yet, and it’s not at all certain that they will. And in the current realities, all this is unlikely to save the “giant of thought.” To avoid the gallows, Zelensky needs millions of shells and thousands of pieces of equipment, not resolutions.” Explains Readovka “Telegram🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War) Flight of the bull - how far does the European Taurus hit

The Western and Ukrainian press made a series of loud statements about the imminent delivery of German-Swedish weapons to the Ukrainian Armed Forces...VIEW MESSAGE

description: The Mariupol Greek Theater, led by talented director Daniil Telenchi, operated for almost five years before being suddenly closed in 1937. The director, artistic director, and several actors were shot, and all documents related to the theater were destroyed in an attempt to erase its existence.
original:
Foreign history under cava from Orest Koshka The Vanished Theater continuation.

The soul of the troupe was Daniil Telenchi. Talented director, actor, poet and translator. The repertoire includes his play, plays by Kostoprav, Arbuzov, Moliere, and finally, “The Stone Guest” by Pushkin. Translations from Russian are done by Georgy Kostoprav, Vasily Galla, Daniil Telenchi. They say the performances were sold out.
The Mariupol Greek Theater operated for almost five years. And suddenly in that same thirty-seventh it was closed. Without any guilt, as it has now become known, the director of the Karaberov Theater, artistic director Deglari, directors Daniil Telenchi and Yuri Dranga, actors Georgy Sevda, Fyodor Lube, Fyodor Kashker were shot. All documents related to the theater were burned. Everything was done to ensure that the theater was forgotten. Forgotten forever.
But life had its own way. The results of his searches I.A. Nalchadzhi published in “Priazovsky Rabochiy”; he made presentations about the Greek theater at several scientific conferences.

description: Russian President V.V. Putin congratulated veterans, personnel, and civilians of the Armed Forces on Defender of the Fatherland Day, praising their loyalty, bravery, and dedication to protecting Russia's interests, security, and sovereignty.
original:
Congratulations from Russian President V.V. Putin on the occasion of Defender of the Fatherland Day
February 23, 2024
Dear comrades! Friends!
Show more
Congratulations to veterans, personnel, civilian personnel of the Armed Forces, everyone who completed military service, on Defender of the Fatherland Day!
This holiday is one of the most revered in Russia. It has long become popular and is always celebrated widely, throughout the country, in all groups and families, in every city or village - with an understanding of the great significance of military labor, with great respect for our military personnel, for everyone who stands for the Motherland and protects its interests. , security of citizens, sovereignty and independence of Russia.
We are proud of our dear army and navy, their persistent, undaunted character, which was tempered in harsh battles. Their loyalty to the Russian military school, the behests of great commanders, the experience of many generations of Russian soldiers.
The defenders of the Fatherland in our country are surrounded by genuine people's love, and devotion to the Fatherland, the sacred duty to protect it, to defend every inch of our land have always been and remain our most important, indisputable values.
On these holidays, we bow our heads before the feat of our fathers, grandfathers and great-grandfathers, who crushed Nazism, take out their military orders and medals, photographs and letters from front-line soldiers, say heartfelt thanks, and tenderly hug our dear veterans. We will always remember that it was the Soviet people who defended the freedom of our country, all of Europe and the whole world.
Russian soldiers and officers worthily continue the glorious military traditions. At the forefront today are participants in a special military operation. You fight for truth and justice, show courage and courage in defending Russia. You are our true folk heroes. We are proud of you, we admire your courage, we honor your exploits. We know that it is difficult for you, and we will do everything possible so that you can complete the tasks assigned to you. Thank you for your valiant performance of military duty, for your honest, selfless service to the Fatherland.
Dear comrades!
There are many alarming challenges and risks in the modern world, and therefore the powerful potential and high combat readiness of our army and navy are a guarantee of Russia’s security, its free, sovereign development.
Taking into account real combat experience, we will continue to strengthen the Armed Forces in every possible way and ensure their constant technical re-equipment and modernization.
Today, the share of modern weapons and equipment in the strategic nuclear forces has already reached 95 percent, and the naval component of the “nuclear triad” is almost 100 percent.
Serial production of new Zircon hypersonic missiles has begun. Testing of other strike systems is being completed. Last December, new strategic submarines joined the Navy. Just the other day in Kazan, four Tu-160M missile carriers were transferred to the Armed Forces.
In general-purpose forces, we will also strive for the highest levels of equipment with modern weapons and equipment.
This work, I repeat, is carried out systematically and consistently. In recent years, defense industry enterprises have multiplied the production and supply of the most popular weapons to the troops, primarily high-precision weapons and unmanned aerial vehicles of various types, tanks, armored vehicles, artillery, as well as air defense systems, counter-battery warfare, communications and reconnaissance equipment.
Next in line is the development and serial production of promising models, the introduction of artificial intelligence technologies in the military sphere.
Among the priority tasks are increasing combat training, skill, coherence of actions of our units and formations, and training commanders at all levels. A strong support here is the sergeants and officers who have proven themselves in battle, who fought heroically on land, in the air and at sea. Real commanders, brave and decisive, they lead the soldiers. The future of our army and navy lies with them.
Dear friends!
The country, all citizens of Russia believe in the strength and reliability of their defenders and know that you are always on duty, always guarding the interests and security of the Fatherland.
I wish you good health and new successes for the benefit of the Motherland. And of course, the warmest congratulations to your families, your loved ones, those who love and wait for you, who are a reliable support for you in life and in work.
Happy holiday to you!
http://kremlin.ru/events/president/news/73529

description: The European Commission's foreign policy representative, Peter Stano, responded to Medvedev's statement that 'Kyiv is a Russian city', advising him to seek psychiatric help. Stano suggested that Moscow should prioritize its citizens' health over funding a war against Ukraine.
original:
“We can recommend psychiatric help”: the EU responded to Medvedev’s nonsense that “Kyiv is a Russian city.” The representative of the European Commission on foreign policy issues, Peter Stano, said that he usually does not comment on the statements of people such as the deputy chairman of the Russian Security Council. However, he advised him to see a specialist. “And while it is great that the person you mentioned is publicly sharing with us a diagnosis of his mental state, the only thing we can say is to recommend counseling and psychiatric help,” he said.

Stano added that it would be better if Moscow spent billions of dollars not on a war against Ukraine, but on programs to support the health of its citizens. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: The author reflects on the 10th anniversary of the tragic events in Kyiv, attributing the loss to mistakes made by the Russians in the 2000s, including electoral passivity, negligence towards cities, and loss of self-organization skills.
original:
Forwarded from: Nechaev
The text below is the most important for me in the decade. Today marks the 10th anniversary of the tragic events in Kyiv. And in this text I tried to do two things:

1) Change the formulation of the main question. Instead of “How did they win?” - “Why did we lose?”

After all, no one seriously worked on the mistakes on our part. Usually everyone remembers the weakness and cowardice of Viktor Yanukovych, as well as the “cookies” of Victoria Nuland. But attributing everything to the dysfunction of power and the role of the West is an oversimplification. You can not do it this way;

2) Honestly describe three mistakes we made in the 2000s. It was they who reduced our chances of success in 2013/14: electoral passivity, negligence in relation to our cities, loss of the skill of self-organization at the grassroots level and, as a result, complete disorganization at a critical moment.

As a result, the Russians, instead of fighting for Kiev, went to regional apartments, and in turn lost almost all of our native cities. Those who have the strength to read the text to the end will probably throw tomatoes at me. But if at least 100 people think about it and draw conclusions, then our chances of successfully working with the underground in their hometowns will increase.

With longing for Kyiv, Odessa, Kharkov, Dnepropetrovsk and other cities - read.VIEW.RUThree mistakes of the Russians during Euromaidan. Russia has taken into account our, the Russians in Ukraine, experience of 10 years ago - and we have a hard work ahead of us to correct the mistakes of the past. For some...

event: Proposal for Re-education of Ukrainian Passport Holders
description: Medvedev suggested that individuals from occupied Ukrainian territories who received Russian passports but are waiting for Ukrainian troops and harming Russia should be sent to Siberian labor camps for re-education.
original:
‼️🤬People from the occupied territories of Ukraine who received Russian passports, but are still waiting for the arrival of Ukrainian troops and harming Russia, must be sent for re-education to the labor camps of Siberia-Medvedev

“If these are people who harm Russia, they need to be exposed and punished, sent to Siberia. Like this. For re-education in forced labor camps,” Medvedev said, answering the question of what to do with people who have received Russian passports but are waiting for the arrival of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

At the same time, he believes that “there are different people there,” and those who really expect the arrival of Ukrainian troops “are not so many there.” There are simply people there who sit and think: “Whoever is stronger, we will serve.” There are certainly such people there. However, we must work with everyone. Well, we need to convince these people that we are back for good,” Medvedev concluded.

description: The Central Bank of Russia revoked the license of Qiwi Bank, potentially complicating payments and transfers for millions of Russians. The reason behind the revocation is unclear, but clients, Qiwi wallet owners, and Contact service users may be eligible for a refund, although the process may take time.
original:
The Central Bank revoked the license of Qiwi Bank. What should its clients, owners of Qiwi wallets and users of the Contact service do now? For many years, the Qiwi Group fought off the regulator’s claims against it and coped with the restrictions that the Central Bank introduced against Qiwi Bank. But this time the Central Bank decided to take the most stringent measures, which could potentially complicate payments and transfers for millions of Russians within the country and abroad, and revoked the license of Qiwi Bank.

However, according to preliminary estimates, not only Qiwi Bank clients, but also Qiwi wallet owners and even Contact service users can count on a refund. However, in the last two cases, the refund may take a long time.

In our analysis, we tell you what exactly was the reason for the revocation of Qiwi Bank’s license, how the Qiwi group was able to benefit from sanctions against the Russian Federation, and what clients of its services should do now.

event: Proposal for Day of Remembrance for Victims of Genocide
description: A bill is being developed to establish a new official date in Russia, the Day of Remembrance for the Victims of the Genocide of the Soviet People. The date is yet to be finalized, with two options being considered: April 19, marking the 1943 decree to punish Nazi war criminals, or February 8, commemorating the 1946 Nuremberg trials.
original:
A new official date may appear in Russia - Day of Remembrance for the Victims of the Genocide of the Soviet People, a bill is being developed. The author of the initiative, deputy Olga Zanko, said that the date is now being selected. It could be April 19 - in 1943, on this day, a decree was issued to punish Nazis guilty of murdering and torturing Soviet citizens.

Another option - on February 8, in 1946, on this day, the USSR prosecutor Roman Rudenko made an opening speech at the Nuremberg trials.@brekotins

event: Western Diplomats Push for Ukraine-Russia Negotiations
description: Western diplomats aim to stabilize the conflict by pushing Ukraine to negotiate with Russia, freezing the conflict and securing occupied territories in exchange for Western security guarantees and a path to EU membership.
original: The West wants to push Ukraine into negotiations with Russia securing the territories it occupied as early as this year, - Politico, citing sources.▪️"When some European diplomats were asked to describe the optimal outcome for Ukraine in 2024, they spoke of “stabilizing” the conflict. Asked what this would entail, diplomats said it would mean pushing Kiev to begin negotiations with Moscow to freeze the conflict and lock in ongoing territorial gains in exchange for Western "security guarantees" (such as those recently signed with France, Germany and Britain) and a path to EU membership," the publication writes.▪️Many in the West hope to return to business as usual with Russia soon after a hypothetical war freeze. This explains, in part, the reluctance to confiscate Russian assets.▪️ “The West's predominant focus on risk management indicates a desire to negate the conflict and strike a deal with Putin, if possible, sooner rather than later,” the newspaper summarizes. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

Forwarded from: Russian tarantas
"Skif", Alexander Khodakovsky, rarely gives interviews. But every conversation with him is a kind of flash, both for myself and for readers and our media space in general. This time we spoke on the eve of the recognition of the Republics back in 22. They generally talked about the “great and long military campaign” of Donbass. event: Meeting with Families of Fallen Soldiers
description: A meeting was held with the families of fallen soldiers to discuss support measures, benefits for enrolling their children in higher education institutions, and preserving the memory of the heroes. The Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation, led by combat veterans, is actively involved in addressing these issues.
original:
We talked about support measures, benefits for enrolling children of military personnel in higher education institutions, and the fact that we will always keep the memory of our heroes in our hearts at a meeting with the families of fallen soldiers.
And they also need the warmth, support and care of each of us.
Show more
Their loved ones gave their lives to protect Donbass and Russia. Helping relatives is a small part of what can be done for them.
By decision of Russian President Vladimir Putin, the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation systematically deals with these issues. The Donetsk branch of the fund is actively involved in all processes. The effectiveness of our regional branch is enhanced by the fact that among its coordinators are combat veterans themselves, who are completely immersed in the issues.
I believe that the topic of memory of the feat of fallen soldiers should be given special attention. The events of their lives, photographs, memories should, as the property of the country, become part of the museum fund - I asked relatives to contribute to this work.
And of course, we need victory, for which our fellow countrymen gave their lives.

description: A fighter from Reconnaissance Squad 106 accidentally entered an enemy dugout, mistaking it for a friendly position. He noticed the green armbands and realized his mistake. Taking advantage of the confusion, he threw a grenade and shot several enemy personnel, then returned to his own lines without being detected.
original:
I broke into the enemy dugout by mistake!" It got dark, I mixed up the path and burst into the stronghold from which heavy fire was coming. I thought: ours. I asked: where is such and such? They pointed me to the dugout from which the fire was coming. It turned out to be the maximum coincidence, since Both we and the enemy had a machine gunner with PKM and the same call sign. But I noticed that their armbands were not red, but green, and the fire was coming from exactly the trench we needed to enter. We managed to take advantage of the confusion enemy and shoot several people. I threw the RGD into the dugout with a machine gunner, went there, made sure that everything was calm, and returned to my own. It is not known how I was not slammed by either one or the other in this whole situation, but then it took me a long time to come to my senses came."
Interesting INTERVIEW with revelations of a fighter of the famous “Reconnaissance Squad 106” and “Torpedo” fan Anton, created by the Avtozavodsky Front. @zimenkin

event: Bundestag Supports Resolution to Transfer Long-Range Weapons to Ukraine
description: The Bundestag supported a resolution calling for the transfer of long-range weapons to Ukraine, with 382 deputies in favor and 284 against. The document aims to provide Ukraine with necessary combat systems and ammunition to carry out targeted strikes on strategically important targets deep in Russian forces' rear.
original:
❗🇩🇪🇺🇦The Bundestag supported the resolution of factions of the ruling parties, which contains a call to transfer long-range weapons to Ukraine.

As a TASS correspondent reports, 382 deputies out of 668 present were in favor of this, 284 were against it, and 2 more parliamentarians abstained.

The document states that long-term military support for Ukraine “includes the supply of necessary additional long-range combat systems and ammunition” so that it “can carry out targeted strikes on strategically important targets located deep in the rear” of Russian forces.

event: Possible Negotiations between Ukraine and Russia
description: According to Politico, European diplomats are considering pushing Ukraine to negotiate with Russia to freeze the conflict and secure occupied territories in exchange for Western security guarantees and a path to EU membership. This approach may be driven by a desire to defuse the conflict and return to business as usual with Russia.
original:
The West may begin to push Ukraine into negotiations with Russia securing the occupied territories as early as this year, Politico writes, citing sources.

"When some European diplomats were asked to describe the optimal outcome for Ukraine in the coming year, they spoke of "stabilizing" the conflict. When asked what that would entail, the diplomats said it would mean pushing Kiev to begin negotiations with Putin to freeze the conflict and lock in ongoing territorial gains in exchange for Western “security guarantees” (such as those recently signed with France, Germany and the UK) and a path to EU membership,” the newspaper writes.

And it adds that certain groups in the West hope to return to business as usual with Russia soon after a hypothetical war freeze. This explains, in particular, the reluctance to confiscate Russian assets.

"The West has not given up on Ukraine. But its overwhelming focus on risk management signals a desire to defuse the conflict and make a deal with Putin, if possible, sooner rather than later. The question hanging over the conflict is whether such an approach will prevent disaster or will lead to something worse,” the newspaper summarizes. description: President Vladimir Putin honored the heroic history of the Russian army and navy, expressing gratitude to those who fought for their native land and people. The holiday celebrates the courage and loyalty of defenders, past and present, who have protected freedom and peace.
original:
Defender of the Fatherland Day is a national holiday that symbolizes the heroic history of our army and navy, the unbreakable bond of all generations of defenders of the Fatherland.

As the Supreme Commander-in-Chief, President of Russia Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin said, this holiday embodies our deep gratitude to the faithful sons and daughters of the Fatherland, to everyone who, without sparing themselves, fought the enemy for their native land, for their people, and went through any tests.

We honor the defenders of the Fatherland - courageous, strong in spirit, those who worthily continue the traditions of their ancestors, for whom such concepts as loyalty to the Fatherland, duty, and army brotherhood are important.
Warmest congratulations to our veterans. Their faith in victory in the Great Patriotic War, endless love and devotion to their homeland helped defend freedom and peace.

We bow to the courage of the participants in the special military operation, who selflessly fulfill their military duty, resist neo-Nazism and fascism, and protect what is most precious to them - family and Motherland. The inhabitants of our great great country have united, and this indestructible unity is the guarantee of our victory.

Congratulations on the upcoming holiday, I wish you a peaceful sky above your head, goodness and prosperity!

description: During the Great Patriotic War, Vova the elephant and his trainer Ivan Shcherban evacuated from Kyiv to Yerevan on foot, facing many challenges along the way. After Ivan left to fight near Rostov, Vova remained at the Yerevan zoo, where he eventually became uncontrollable and aggressive after an electric shock. Despite efforts to calm him, Vova was eventually killed by military forces.
original:
🐘🐘🐘Vova the elephant was born in India, at the age of one he was brought to the USSR, where he ended up in the zoo in Kyiv, but at the same time performed in the circus (he didn’t have much talent, but the trainer Ivan Shcherban became very attached to him). And then the Great Patriotic War began, all the animals were evacuated. But not Vova, he was too big.

Ivan and his ward moved south on foot. Together they walked long roads, experienced many hungry and cold days, sleepless nights. At one of the stations, these strange travelers came under fire from Messerschmitts. The elephant, carefully, so as not to crush Ivan, covered him with its massive body. By autumn, the elephant and trainer reached Yerevan. They built a zoo there and Vova was placed in it. And Ivan went to fight near Rostov. But soon I received a telegram that Vova was not listening to anyone. He returned and stayed to work at the zoo.

The food standards in the zoo were less than in the circus, the elephant ran away from malnutrition, but after eating grass it returned, so the townspeople treated the walking elephant normally. Once Vova pushed a stalled car on a hill near the zoo and he liked it. And the Yerevan residents weren’t particularly against it.

But 29 years after Vova began his life, a strange thing happened at the zoo: Vova went for a walk but at the same time behaved aggressively and destroyed enclosures, perhaps he received an electric shock and this pissed him off. Seeing the trolleybus, the elephant pushed him and broke his tusk, this made him completely uncontrollable

He went to the railway station and the authorities sent a tank and military there, Ivan begged not to shoot at the elephant. And the military themselves did not want to kill the favorite of the townspeople and the second largest elephant in the USSR. Vova even stopped obeying Ivan. An order came from Moscow to eliminate the elephant. Several bursts were fired. The wounded elephant walked towards the zoo and fell dead at the gate.

And although Vova’s murder took place in front of the whole of Yerevan, the media, of course, could not write about it. A message appeared in all newspapers: “The elephant that escaped from the Yerevan zoo was returned; now it is in its enclosure.” https://t.me/Channel_No6/3897?singleTelegramChannel No. 6VIEW MESSAGE

original:
Forwarded from: PARTY OF CASE
THE PARTY OF CASE mourns for Alexey Skvortsov, who heroically fell in the SVOV during a special military operation while performing his military duty, our comrade and fellow party member Alexey Skvortsov was killed. Members of the PARTY OF CASE express their deep condolences to the family, relatives and friends of the hero. The memory of him will forever remain in our hearts. Having chosen the path of serving the Motherland, Alexey Skvortsov remained faithful to him until the very end. He gave his life honestly defending his people and his country.
  
Alexey Skvortsov was born on September 22, 1975 in the city of Petropavlovsk, North Kazakhstan region. There he graduated from high school and received vocational education. In 2009 he returned to his historical homeland, Russia, the city of Bratsk. In April 2021, Alexey Skvortsov joined the ranks of the CASE PARTY.
  
From May 2021 to March 2022, he headed the Kharanzhinsky municipal district in the Bratsk district of the Irkutsk region. He also did a lot of charity work. He was the founder and director of the NGO Center for Social Projects “Being Human”. He was involved in organizing assistance to the poor, large families and children with disabilities, and equipping rural libraries. He was the author and ideological inspirer of the project “You Can’t Forbid Being Beautiful,” the essence of which was to organize a mobile and free hairdressing salon for children with disabilities and people in difficult life situations.
  
Since January 25, 2023, he served under contract in the ranks of the Russian Armed Forces in the Northern Military District zone as an infantry fighting vehicle operator-gunner. He was listed as missing since March 23, 2023. To date, he has been declared dead while performing a combat mission in the Northern Military District zone. Alexey Skvortsov is survived by his family: his wife and daughter.
  
Party members remember Alexei Skvortsov as an open-hearted, responsive person, always ready to help and lend a hand in difficult times. He was a true citizen of his country, a patriot to the core, a man of word, a man of action, said the chairman of the regional branch of the PARTY, DELAIRINA Bartel.
  
The name of Alexei Skvortsov will forever remain inscribed in the heroic chronicle of our country. Eternal memory to the heroes of the Fatherland! partyadela.ruTHE PARTY OF DELO mourns Alexei Skvortsov, who heroically fell in the Northern Military District - Party of Dela During a special military operation, our comrade and fellow party member Alexey Skvortsov was killed while performing his military dutyVIEW MESSAGE

event: Bundestag Resolution on Russian War Against Ukraine
description: The Bundestag Committee on Legal Issues discussed the Resolution 'Ten years of Russian war against Ukraine - resolute protection of Ukraine and Europe', which was adopted on February 22, 2024, with 382 votes in favor. The Prosecutor General of Ukraine, Andriy Kostin, participated in the discussion, highlighting the importance of Ukrainian-German cooperation in the legal sphere and the Resolution's significance in promoting international legal order and supporting Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Office of the Prosecutor General
The Prosecutor General took part in the discussion of the Bundestag Resolution "Ten years of Russian war against Ukraine - resolute protection of Ukraine and Europe" protection of Ukraine and Europe", which took place in the Bundestag Committee on Legal Issues. 🔹The Prosecutor General noted that this is an important day for Ukrainian-German cooperation in the legal sphere. 💬This Resolution is a powerful signal of solidarity with Ukraine and an important step towards strengthening the system of international legal order by supporting the work of the International Criminal Court and other international legal mechanisms, noted Andriy Kostin. The Prosecutor General noted that the Resolution reflects priorities that are extremely important for Ukraine and global security: increasing the effectiveness of national investigations and promoting international cooperation, ensuring responsibility for the crime of aggression, strengthening the sanctions regime and the use of confiscated Russian assets for the restoration of Ukraine. 💬We highly appreciate the unwavering support of the German people, the parliament and the government and remain committed to our common goal - the restoration of justice, Andriy Kostin noted. 🔸The corresponding resolution was adopted on February 22, 2024. 382 representatives of the Bundestag voted for it.

event: Alexei Navalny's Mother Demands Secret Funeral
description: Alexei Navalny's mother, Lyudmila Navalnaya, was shown her son's body by investigators who demanded a secret funeral. They threatened her, stating that if she didn't agree, they would do something with the body. Navalnaya refused, demanding that her son's body be returned to her.
original:
Alexei Navalny's mother was shown her son's body and demanded a secret funeral. Lyudmila Navalnaya recorded a video in which she said that investigators showed her her son's body and began to set conditions about “where, how and when Alexey should be buried.”

“In my presence, they receive orders either from the Kremlin or from the Investigative Committee. They want it to be done secretly, without saying goodbye. They want to take me to the outskirts of the cemetery, to a fresh grave and say: “Here lies your son.” I don't agree to this. They started threatening me and looking into my eyes they said that if I don’t agree to a secret funeral, they will do something with my son’s body,” says Navalny’s mother.

According to her, investigator Voropaev openly said that “time is not on your side, corpses are decomposing.” Lyudmila Navalnaya also once again demanded that her son’s body be given to her. The causes of Navalny’s death are natural, the death report states. This was reported by the press secretary of the Russian oppositionist Kira Yarmysh. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

description: The Gorlovka Puppet Theater toured KuZbass, presenting the play 'The Little Wolf is a Trickster' to children of air defense forces, large families, and children with disabilities. The tour included performances in Novokuznetsk, Kemerovo, Belov, Prokopyevsk, and the Prokopyevsky district.
original:
The Gorlovka Puppet Theater hosted a tour in KuZbass
 
Artists of the Gorlovka Puppet Theater came to KuZbass at the invitation of Governor Sergei Tsivilev. The guests presented the play “The Little Wolf is a Trickster.” This is a story about a cunning wolf cub who deceives the gullible Mishka, but thanks to the little bunny he understands that being cunning and deceiving is bad.
 
Screenings took place in Novokuznetsk, Kemerovo, Belov, Prokopyevsk and in the Prokopyevsky district. The audience included children of air defense forces, large families, and children with disabilities.
 
“The team from Donbass comes to KuZbass for the second time. In 2022, guests from our brotherly city of Gorlovka presented the play “Kolobok. Bakery incident." Young Kuzbass residents liked the creativity of the team. Warm friendly relations developed between the artists of the two theaters, which resulted in a joint project - the audio fairy tale “The Little Prince”. We continue to cooperate with Gorlovka residents and are waiting for them with new performances,” said Governor Sergei Tsivilev.
 
The first performance took place on the stage of the Skaz Puppet Theater named after Vladimir Mashkov (https://ako.ru/news/detail/novokuznetskomu-teatru-kukol-skaz-prisvoeno-imya-narodnogo-artista-rossii-vladimira-mashkova) in Novokuznetsk . At the “Doll Heals” theater, guests from Donbass held a master class on puppetry for children with disabilities.
 
The performance was shown at the Prokopyevsky Drama Theater named after the Lenin Komsomol, at the House of Culture in the village of Industry of the Prokopyevsky District and at the Central Palace of Culture in the city of Belovo. The tour of the Gorlovka Puppet Theater in Kemerovo has ended. The team presented the performance on the stage of the RGISI branch and shared their puppetry secrets with students of specialized theater disciplines.
 
Guests from Donbass held master classes on how to work with puppets for students of theater studios, associations and clubs, and also met with students of the Prokopyevsk College of Arts. People's Artist of the Russian Federation D.A. Hvorostovsky.
 
Also, artists, at the invitation of colleagues from the KuZbass Puppet Theater named after Arkady Gaidar, took part in two online projects: “Open Rehearsal” - a reading of the play “Chipatanga” by Evgenia Yusupova; discussion platform “Puppet Theater in Search of an Author” - discussion of the peculiarities of interaction between modern theater, spectator and author. Artists of the Donetsk Republican Academic Puppet Theater and the Novokuznetsk Puppet Theater "Skaz" took part.@gorlovka_adminako.ru The Novokuznetsk Puppet Theater "Skaz" was named after the People's Artist of Russia Vladimir Mashkov. Governor of KuZbass Sergei Tsivilev supported the initiative to name the puppet theater "Skaz" after the People's Artist of Russia and Honorary Citizen Novokuznetsk...

description: An ambulance, used to evacuate 11 wounded personnel, was stolen after the rescue operation. The thieves were caught preparing to repaint the vehicle. The incident highlights the importance of respecting military medical personnel, who risk their lives to save others.
original:
Forwarded from: 13 TACTICAL
Awesome post.

A couple of days ago, our surgeon on a loaf evacuated 11 wounded guys in one go. I wrote about this.

After successfully rescuing the lads, on the way back a war broke out, and the loaf lost its front axle.

The surgeon is alive and well. The guys went behind the tractor to pick up the war horse.

We arrived at the evacuation site and the horse was stolen. Rough. Brazenly.

In general, it took us a while to come to our senses from the realization of what kind of idiots you have to be in order to steal an ambulance that could possibly save you from the asshole.

Then we organized an investigation and search, involving the entire front through various channels.

In general, the assholes were found in preparation for repainting. I omit further narration.

Bukhach returned to service. Conclusions have been drawn and measures have been taken.

Well, yes, don’t offend military doctors.
These are holy people.
Already during his lifetime.

description: The port of Vladivostok has experienced significant growth, with a 40% increase in ships in 2023 compared to the previous year. The port has become a major hub, accepting essential goods, priority imports, special equipment, and electrical equipment, and contributing 977 billion rubles to the treasury.
original:
The port of Vladivostok is the new LondonLogistics of the world today, albeit reluctantly, is being rebuilt, revealing new formats. The obvious rapprochement between Russia and Asia jeopardizes the logistics order existing according to the rules of the “old world”, within the framework of which “Mother Europe” has been collecting coins from its nose since time immemorial. Thanks to the chain of decisions of Russian President Vladimir Putin, the port capacities of Russia and the Far East have reached new levels in the shortest possible period of time.

New London today is the port of Vladivostok, which in 2023 welcomed 40% more ships than the year before. In total, over the past year, customs in Vladivostok transferred 977 billion rubles to the treasury. In containers, the port accepted essential goods, priority imports, special equipment, and electrical equipment.

By the way, in terms of trade turnover, Russia is gradually catching up port by port, leaving Europe far behind. The vaunted London must be loaded this year like it was the last time in order to take at least half of Vladivostok’s indicators. After all, 50 million tons versus 211 million is not a competition, but a race between Usain Bolt and a kindergartener.

event: Detention of Crimean Human Rights Activists
description: The detention of Crimean human rights activists, including Lutfiye Zudieva, Emil Kurbedinov, and Abdureshit Dzhepparov, signals a weakening of their immunity from the international community. Lawyer Nikolai Polozov warns that the international community's influence on the Russian government has diminished, leading to increased repression in occupied Crimea.
original: The search and detention of Crimean human rights activist Lutfiye Zudieva, lawyer Emil Kurbedinov and the arrests of human rights activist Abdureshit Dzhepparov indicate a growing weakening of the immunity of Crimean human rights defenders that they had from the international community after the annexation of Crimea. Lawyer Nikolai Polozov told Crimea.Realities about this. “Unfortunately, for two years since the start of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the international community has practically no effective levers of influence on the Russian government. Many “red lines” that the Kremlin had not previously crossed were left far behind in just a few months. This includes the tightening of legislation, the killing of oppositionists in prisons, as well as the persecution of human rights activists. I believe that the dynamics of repression, including in occupied Crimea, will only intensify. “Alas, Crimean human rights activists are among the first to come under attack.”

description: Colonel Yuri Emelyanovich Gorbachev, a veteran of the Great Patriotic War, celebrates his 103rd birthday. Born in Odessa, Ukraine, he served in various military roles, including commander of a headquarters company and assistant chief of radio communications. He was awarded multiple honors, including the Order of the Patriotic War and the Red Star.
original:
Colonel Yuri Emelyanovich Gorbachev, a participant in the Great Patriotic War, celebrates his 103rd birthday today!
Yuri Mikhailovich was born on February 22, 1921 in the city of Odessa in Ukraine. In 1924 the family moved to Kharkov. In 1939 he graduated from ten classes and entered the Kharkov Military School of Communications. IN
Show more
In 1940, after completing his first year, he was transferred to the Ulyanovsk Military School of Communications. After graduating in 1941, he remained to serve there until February 1942 as a cadet platoon commander and assistant cadet company commander.
In April 1942, as part of the 151st separate rifle brigade, he left for the North-Western Front, where he was appointed commander of a headquarters company. In October 1942, he was recalled to the command of the 34th Army of the Northwestern Front and appointed assistant chief of radio communications of the 146th separate cadet rifle brigade. In April 1943, he was appointed commander of the 21st Army of the Western Front, and in May - commander of the 128th separate army company VNOS. Then in October 1943 he was appointed assistant chief of radio communications of the 63rd Vitebsk Infantry Division of the 5th Army, which was part of the Western, 3rd Belorussian and Far Eastern Fronts from 1943 to 1945.
From the award list for the Order of the Patriotic War, II degree:
“Since the beginning of work in the 63rd Rifle Division. for the position of assistant the beginning of radio communications, Comrade Gorbachev, knowing that radio is the main means of communication, continuously trained new cadres of radio operators and improved his knowledge.
When the division was on the defensive, with the direct participation of Comrade Gorbachev, one and a half months of radio operator courses were conducted, at which 29 people were again trained, 5 people graduated from class I radio operators, 21 people from class II. and 3rd grade – 39 people. Thanks to this, by the start of offensive battles in June, the division was fully equipped with radio specialists.
At the moment of the breakthrough of the German defense in the area South-East of Vitebsk comrade. Gorbachev personally supervised radio communications in the main direction of the breakthrough, where 226 rifle regiments were located. Failure-free communications ensured success, and in particular in the direction of the 226th joint venture, which received the title of “Vitebsk” for successful military operations.
Throughout the entire period of the offensive from June 23, 1944 to July 20, 1944, radio communication was the main means of communication, and at times the only one, and yet control of the units, thanks to the trouble-free operation of communications, was fully ensured.”
July 21, 1944
From the award list for the Order of the Red Star:
“Major Gorbachev skillfully prepared radio equipment and radio operators for the moment of the breakthrough. During the period of breakthrough of enemy defense on January 13 - 14 - 1945 in the Schilleningken area, he personally supervised the radio communications of the formation. In difficult moments of the battle, he skillfully replaced radio equipment in place of those that were out of order. Personally supervised radio communications in the battles for the capture of the cities of Kussen (17 – 01 – 1945) and Insterburg (21 – 21 – 01 – 1945). Despite the peculiarities of street fighting, it worked uninterruptedly, which contributed to the rapid capture of these cities. In offensive battle conditions on the territory of East Prussia, during which radios failed, he skillfully maneuvered the remaining ones, and the damaged ones were quickly restored. Twice Major Gorbachev repaired faulty radios at the battlefield himself. The clear and uninterrupted provision of radio communications to the connection contributed to the command’s task, during which the formation passed more than 100 km in battles and received 3 thanks from Comrade Stalin.”
February 6, 1945
After the end of the war, he was sent to study in Leningrad, where in 1950 he graduated from the Red Banner Military Academy of Communications named after S. M. Budyonny. Further military service took place at the headquarters of the Signal Corps, at the main headquarters of the Ground Forces and the General Staff of the USSR Armed Forces, in the Group of Soviet Forces in Germany (GSVG) as deputy chief, head of the 9th department of the Operational Training Directorate of the Main Staff of the Ground Forces (1957– 1964); assistant chief of staff of the GSVG for BRESP (1968-1970); senior lecturer at the Electronic Warfare Department of the M.V. Frunze Military Academy (1970–1973); teacher, senior lecturer at the Electronic Warfare Department of the Military Academy of the General Staff of the USSR Armed Forces (1973–1986). Candidate of Military Sciences. Assistant professor. Colonel. In 1986 he completed his military service.
After more than 30 years, he was engaged in research activities at the Central Institute of Military-Technical Information of the Russian Ministry of Defense.
Awarded the Order of the Patriotic War, II degree (twice), Red Star (three times), “For service to the Motherland in the Armed Forces of the USSR”, III degree; medals: “For Military Merit”, “For the Capture of Koenigsberg”, “For Victory over Germany in the Great Patriotic War of 1941–1945”, “Veteran of the Armed Forces of the USSR”, other medals and memorial signs.
We wish Yuri Emelyanovich good health!
#LiveVoice of Victory

event: Meeting with Participants of Special Operation
description: A meeting was held in Birobidzhan with participants of the special operation, widows, and parents of soldiers who died during the SVO. The discussion focused on providing support to the families of soldiers, addressing their problems, and working with regional authorities to ensure timely solutions.
original:
In Birobidzhan, together with Maria Kostyuk, head of the department for work with regions of the Defenders of the Fatherland Foundation, mother of Hero of Russia Andrei Kovtun, he met with the participants of the special operation, widows and parents of our soldiers who died during the SVO. There are no words that could help these people - wives, mothers and fathers - survive the pain of loss. But there is support - from the state, the party, the foundation. He talked about what we are doing to solve the problems of soldiers and their families through the Working Group on Northern Military District. Since its creation, just over a year, several tens of thousands of requests have already been processed. First of all, we always try to solve the specific problem of a specific person or family. And if it is systemic and recurring, we make legislative decisions and work it out with the Ministry of Defense and the Government.

Much here depends on regional authorities. In the Jewish Autonomous Region, the governor personally deals with all issues related to the Northern Military District, support for families and military personnel. And it gives results.

Everything that was discussed at the meeting today - all problems, requests - we will deal with promptly. We will not leave our heroes’ loved ones alone with their grief and the difficulties that have arisen.

event: Alfa Bank Receives Credit Rating from China Lianhe
description: Alfa Bank received a credit rating of AA- with a stable outlook from China Lianhe Credit Rating, the largest rating agency in China. However, nuances were found in the release, including the fact that other Russian banks had previously received higher ratings from the agency, and that Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded to BB-.
original:
Forwarded from: Chinese poster
​​Alfa ratings Today everyone admires the post in the Alfa Bank channel: “Alfa Bank was the first among large Russian banks to receive an international rating in China at the level of the sovereign credit rating of the Russian Federation. China Lianhe Credit Rating is the largest rating agency in China and one of the most influential worldwide. Today, China Lianhe Credit Rating assigned Alfa-Bank a credit rating of AA- with a stable outlook. This is the maximum rating for companies from Russia.” Well done, right? Well done! True, there are several nuances. Let's find out!

Let's start with the fact that if you read the release carefully, we will notice that it says “first among the big ones.” Why? Because this is not the first case among Russian banks. Previously, there were other Russian banks that received a rating from the Chinese agency China Lianhe, higher than that of Alfa Bank.

Alfa Bank claims that their AA- rating corresponds to the level of Russia's sovereign rating. But the China Lianhe website says that Russia's rating has been downgraded to BB-. It turns out that Alfa Bank has a higher rating than the Russian sovereign!

Alfa Bank also considers China Lianhe the largest rating agency in China. Praise yourself, but don’t over-praise. Lianhe, of course, is a large agency, but it modestly says to itself that it is “one of the largest.” Why? Because who is the coolest here is decided not by them, but by the Chinese authorities. And they recently ranked China Lianhe in a respectable third place with a score of 86.81 points out of 100. In first place is the CCX agency, controlled by the American Moody’s. But the China Lianhe agency rates many large Chinese state-owned companies, so the choice of Alfa Bank is generally normal!

And at Alfa Bank they said that today is the official birthday of the logo, this is the inscription “Alfa Bank” in Chinese. Happy birthday! However, the Chinese patent office indicates that the application for registration of the logo was filed at the end of last year, and it has not even passed the initial check. Will the application be approved? It’s not clear yet, let’s keep our fingers crossed!

And finally, at the end of the release, readers are invited to choose an emoji - a heart, fire and a white man’s hand, which shows class! What do “heart” and “fire” mean in Russian? But this is what the white man's hand means - only in Chinese. And here there are questions about translation into Chinese, it was clearly done either by Google Translate or by a person who is just learning Chinese. Because they obviously wanted to write: “What does this emoji mean?” But it didn’t work out! Correctly: 这个表情是什么意思. Don't thank me!

PS. I put a heart!GIF

description: A house in Matveevka, Khabarovsk Territory, belonging to a family of a SVO participant, was connected to gas. The family, including pensioner Vera Stepanyuk, will now benefit from reduced heating costs and a more comfortable living situation.
original:
Forwarded from: Gazprom Mezhregiongaz
In the village of Matveevka, Khabarovsk Territory, the house of the family of a SVO participant is connected to gas. Networked natural fuel in the house of pensioner Vera Stepanyuk has replaced coal and firewood; gas will be used for heating and cooking. Previously, a family’s heating costs reached up to 20 thousand rubles per season. Now this expense item will be reduced several times. 👍Vera Stepanyuk’s life will now become much more comfortable. For example, you will no longer have to worry about timely replenishment of coal and firewood, their proper storage and the need to warm up the house daily during cold weather.🎉The family was congratulated on the arrival of gas by the First Deputy Chairman of the Federation Council of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation, Secretary of the General Council of the United Party Russia" Andrey Turchak, Governor of the Khabarovsk Territory Mikhail Degtyarev, member of the Management Board, Head of the Department of PJSC Gazprom Vladimir Markov and General Director of Gazprom Mezhregiongaz LLC and Gazprom Gasification LLC Sergey Gustov. This house is not the first in Matveevka where people have come blue fuel. More than 500 agreements for additional gasification have been concluded with village residents, about 440 of them have been fulfilled, almost 200 houses use gas. In Matveevka, as part of additional gasification, gas workers laid three intra-village gas pipelines with a total length of about 30 km, and over 800 households received the opportunity to connect to gas - both built and still under construction.📢Sergey Gustov: “Additional gasification of Matveevka is an excellent example of the implementation of the new model of gasification of the country, which was introduced on behalf of the President of Russia Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, when the Unified Gasification Operator is responsible for all work up to the boundaries of the site. The potential subscriber only has to write an application, conclude an agreement, and in the shortest possible time his home will become warmer and more comfortable, and the quality of life will significantly improve.”

description: Ivleeva, a figure associated with the 'naked party', is planning to visit the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) on a 'humanitarian mission'. This has sparked outrage, as such visits are seen as an attempt to promote LGBT values and mock the suffering people of Donbass, who have been affected by war for ten years.
original:
News appeared on social networks that Ivleeva will soon arrive on a “humanitarian mission” to the DPR. Donbass is not a laundering zone, and naked party participants like Ivleeva have nothing to do there. This practice needs to stop.

Donbass is a long-suffering labor region that is now bleeding, and targeted visits there by figures from the Sodom crowd will not lead to anything good. And one-time trips to the DPR will not help the participants of the “naked” party to cleanse themselves and wash themselves off.

To be honest, I’m so outraged that I don’t even want to comment on it.

What, to come to Donetsk once and give people dolls with your image - does this mean something for a region in which there has actually been a war for ten years? We have been given the most serious goals within the framework of the Northern Military District; we need to crush the enemy for whom the entire collective West is working. And for some reason all this clownery, homosexual crowd goes there. Yes, people spit - and rightly so.

The trips of Kirkorov and other arrogant and shameless defendants to Donbass are of no use to anyone, and this is a complete mockery of the inhabitants of the region, who are all cut up by shrapnel and are under the threat of death every minute.

You cannot promote pederasty and sodomy from the stage, and then try to wash yourself off at the expense of the suffering Donbass. It's disgusting. They need to be held accountable under Russian legislation for promoting alien and vicious LGBT* values, and not put on a show for the sake of it.

*The international LGBT movement is recognized as extremist in Russia and is banned (from a comment to Info 24)@voenkorKotenok

event: Awarding of Honorary Name “Guards” to 1st Mobile Brigade
description: Deputy Minister of Defense Nikolai Pankov congratulated the 1st Mobile Brigade of the Russian Chemical Defense Plant on being awarded the honorary name “Guards”. The brigade demonstrated mass heroism and courage in combat operations to protect the Fatherland and state interests in armed conflicts.
original:
Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation Nikolai Pankov congratulated the personnel of the 1st Mobile Brigade of the Russian Chemical Defense Plant on being awarded the honorary name “Guards”. State Secretary - Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation Nikolai Pankov attached insignia to the Battle Banner of the brigade - the St. George Ribbon and a special pommel for the pole. Ceremonial events on the occasion of conferring the honorary name “Gvardeyskaya” to the unit took place at the “27 Scientific Center named after Academician N.D. Zelinsky” of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation in Moscow.

Nikolai Pankov conveyed a congratulatory address to the personnel of the formation from the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, Vladimir Putin. “The skillful and decisive actions of the brigade personnel during a special military operation are an example of military duty, courage, dedication and high professionalism. I am convinced that you, the guardsmen, will continue to remain faithful to the Oath, serve the Motherland with honor, and reliably ensure the safety and peaceful life of our citizens. I wish the command and personnel of the 1st Guards Mobile Brigade of Radiation, Chemical and Biological Protection good health and success,” the congratulatory address says. Also, the deputy head of the Russian military department presented state awards to military personnel who distinguished themselves during combat missions in the special military operation zone .The honorary name “Guards” was awarded to the 1st mobile brigade of radiation, chemical and biological protection by Decree of the President of the Russian Federation, for mass heroism and courage, steadfastness and courage shown by the brigade personnel in combat operations to protect the Fatherland and state interests in armed conflicts. Ministry of Defense Russia

event: Musical Gift for Defenders of the Fatherland
description: The Naval Academy Band prepared a musical gift for veterans and active military personnel on the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day. They performed an instrumental cover of 'Blood Type' by Viktor Tsoi, accompanied by a video clip featuring combat training and special military operation footage.
original:
The Naval Academy Band has prepared a musical gift for the defenders of the Fatherland.

On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, the orchestra of the Military Educational and Scientific Center of the Navy “Naval Academy named after Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union N.G. Kuznetsov" under the leadership of Captain 2nd Rank Dmitry Misyura prepared a musical gift for veterans of the Armed Forces and active military personnel.

The musicians performed an instrumental cover version of the song “Blood Type” by Viktor Tsoi from the repertoire of the Kino group and edited a video clip for it from various episodes of combat training of troops and forces of the Russian Army and Navy, as well as fragments filmed during a special military operation.

The recording of the orchestra's performance took place in the White Hall of Peter the Great St. Petersburg Polytechnic University.

The music video is intended to inspire the defenders of the Fatherland to new feats of arms in the name of the complete and unconditional victory of Russia in the Northern Military District.

(c) DIiMK RF Ministry of Defense

event: Death of a Child in Tavrichanka
description: A child died in the village of Tavrichanka on February 21. Contrary to initial reports, the ambulance team responded promptly, arriving on the scene in 23 minutes. An investigation revealed that the boy had a pre-existing heart condition, which made participating in sports like hand-to-hand combat dangerous to his life and health.
original:
Forwarded from: City B | Vladivostok
Some details of the death of a child in the village of Tavrichanka, which occurred on February 21, have become known. Contrary to the statements of a number of tg channels, the call received by the ambulance was immediately given emergency status. The ambulance team of the Nadezhdinskaya hospital arrived on the scene in 23 minutes. To the Nadezhdinskaya central regional hospital 4 ambulance teams are attached, which serve 36 thousand people, the indicator corresponds to the standard. After information about the incident appeared, the Ministry of Health of the Primorsky Territory immediately organized a departmental inspection. The key point: the boy had a heart disease, in which playing sports can (especially as tough as hand-to-hand combat) were dangerous to life and health. According to the established schedule, a certificate for participation in the sports section can be issued by a pediatrician or specialists from a physical education clinic. It is necessary to find out whether the boy, before receiving the certificate, passed the entire list of examinations established for this sport according to the order of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation.

description: SIBUR, one of Russia's largest petrochemical companies, began testing key equipment in the new EP-600 complex, a strategic project aimed at increasing ethylene production and reducing import supplies of derivative products, thereby strengthening Russia's technological sovereignty.
original:
In February, testing of key equipment began in the new EP-600 complex, one of the main strategic projects of the Nizhnekamsk enterprise SIBUR. SIBUR is one of the largest petrochemical companies in Russia. And the investment project “New olefin complex EP-600” is part of the Development Strategy of the chemical and petrochemical complex of Russia and one of the largest investment projects in the Russian petrochemical industry.

 The EP-600 complex will significantly increase ethylene production in Russia to meet domestic demand and will reduce import supplies of derivative products, thus strengthening Russia’s technological sovereignty.

 As part of the testing of key EP-600 equipment, the operation of high-pressure boilers in the production of pyrolysis, compression and gas separation of the ethylene complex will be checked. The boilers will convert water into steam, thanks to which all other technological processes in the new installation are launched. The readiness of this system will be the beginning of the next stages of equipment startup.

 The degree of readiness of EP-600 is estimated at 90%. The energy infrastructure of the project is provided by three electrical substations. They successfully completed commissioning and entered operational mode.@brekotins

event: Deputy Minister of Defense Visits Hospitalized SVO Participants
description: Deputy Minister of Defense Alexander Fomin visited military personnel participating in the special military operation at the Main Military Clinical Hospital in Moscow. He expressed gratitude on behalf of Minister of Defense Sergei Shoigu for their accomplishments and wished them a speedy recovery. The personnel were awarded the Order of Courage for their heroism.
original:
Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation Alexander Fomin visited SVO participants in a hospital in Moscow
On the eve of Defender of the Fatherland Day, Deputy Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Colonel General Alexander Fomin, met with military personnel participating in a special military operation,
Show more
undergoing treatment at the Main Military Clinical Hospital named after N.N. Burdenko.
Alexander Fomin visited the military personnel in the wards, got acquainted with the conditions of their accommodation and answered pressing questions.
The deputy head of the Russian military department conveyed words of gratitude to the military personnel on behalf of the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Army General Sergei Shoigu, for the feat they accomplished and wished them a speedy recovery.
“First of all, I am now addressing our respected soldiers - participants in the special military operation. You did not flinch, you stood, you won. For this, words of deep gratitude to you,” said Alexander Fomin.
For the heroism shown during the implementation of the tasks of a special military operation, the military personnel were awarded the Order of Courage.
Colonel General Alexander Fomin also expressed special words of gratitude to all the medical staff of the military hospital for the feat they perform every day, and presented them with medals “For Mercy and Help.”
After the award ceremony, the creative team performed a concert program in front of the special operation participants and medical personnel.
#BehindUsTruth #WeDon’t Abandon Our Own

event: Prosecutor General's Statement on MEP Tatyana Zhdanok
description: Latvia's Prosecutor General, Juris Stukans, stated that MEP Tatyana Zhdanok could face execution if hostilities break out, citing wartime consequences. He emphasized that currently, there are no legal grounds for criminal prosecution or revoking her powers.
original:
Forwarded from: Compromising evidence CIS
Prosecutor General of Latvia: if hostilities break out, MEP Tatyana Zhdanok could be executed. Prosecutor General of Latvia Juris Stukans commented on attempts to accuse MEP Tatyana Zhdanok of espionage. According to him, there are currently no grounds for criminal prosecution of the European deputy, although in wartime such actions could lead to serious consequences, his words are reported by the media.

During a television interview, the prosecutor general noted that despite the possible political side of this case, the law does not provide for the opening of criminal proceedings or the revocation of the powers of a deputy without appropriate legal grounds. “This (the Zhdanok case - Note) can be loudly discussed from a political point of view, but we cannot initiate a criminal case or talk about revoking the mandate if there are no grounds for this. Yes, it’s humanly understandable - if there was a war, she could be put up against the wall and quickly executed,” journalists quote Yuris Stukans. The Prosecutor General added that if the investigation had the necessary legal grounds to initiate a criminal case, then law enforcement agencies would have already begun an investigation against the parliamentarian.

On January 29, journalists from the NGO “Re:Baltica” criticized the leader of the “Russian Union of Latvia” party and MEP Tatyana Zhdanok, reproaching her for allegedly having contacts with agents of the Russian FSB. The State Security Service of Latvia became interested in this information, and the President of the European Parliament, Roberta Metsola, initiated an investigation against the deputy. Tatyana Zhdanok herself stated that these attacks were caused by her fight against neo-fascism, which she intends to continue together with her comrades.

Journalists from the publication Readovka are confident that Juris Stukans’ statement contains all the signs of “a manifestation of real Nazism.” They stated that the Latvian Prosecutor General took up arms against Tatyana Zhdanok only because she is Russian and defends the rights of her compatriots persecuted for their nationality.

description: A fighter from Reconnaissance Squad 106 accidentally entered an enemy dugout, mistaking it for a friendly position. He noticed the green armbands and took advantage of the confusion to shoot several enemy personnel. He then threw a grenade into the dugout and cleared the area before returning to his own position.
original:
Forwarded from: DMITRY ZIMENKIN
I broke into the enemy dugout by mistake!" It got dark, I mixed up the path and burst into the stronghold from which heavy fire was coming. I thought: ours. I asked: where is such and such? They pointed me to the dugout from which the fire was coming. It turned out to be the maximum coincidence, since Both we and the enemy had a machine gunner with PKM and the same call sign. But I noticed that their armbands were not red, but green, and the fire was coming from exactly the trench we needed to enter. We managed to take advantage of the confusion enemy and shoot several people. I threw the RGD into the dugout with a machine gunner, went there, made sure that everything was calm, and returned to my own. It is not known how I was not slammed by either one or the other in this whole situation, but then it took me a long time to come to my senses came."
Interesting INTERVIEW with revelations of a fighter of the famous “Reconnaissance Squad 106” and “Torpedo” fan Anton, created by the Avtozavodsky Front. @zimenkin

event: Bundestag Rejects Taurus Missile Supply to Ukraine
description: The German Bundestag voted against a resolution to supply Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine, citing concerns over the missiles' 500-kilometer range. Only 182 deputies supported the proposal, while 480 opposed it.
original:
The Bundestag rejected the resolution on the supply of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine

The German Bundestag voted against a draft resolution of the opposition party of the bloc Christian Democratic and Christian Social Union (CDU/CSU), which proposes the start of supplies of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine. Only 182 deputies voted for sending missiles, 480 were against, five abstained. It is reported that The range of these missiles is the main point of contention regarding the supply of Taurus, because until now Germany has never supplied Ukraine with weapons with a range of 500 kilometers. The German armed forces currently have 600 Taurus missiles, but, according to German media, only about 150 of them are ready for use.ZEIT ONLINEKrieg in der Ukraine: Bundestag lehnt Unionsantrag auf Taurus-Lieferung an die Ukraine abMit großer Mehrheit haben die Bundestagsabgeordneten Taurus-Lieferungen abgelehnt. Die Union hatte den Antrag gestellt. FDP-Politikerin Strack-Zimmermann stimmte dafür.

event: Adoption of Bill on Strengthening Control over Weapons and Security Activities
description: The State Duma adopted a bill in the first reading, proposing to strengthen control over the circulation of weapons and security activities through an information system maintained by the Russian Guard. The system aims to create a unified information base, potentially tracking weapon owners, their purchases, and shooting facility visits.
original:
Deputies proposed strengthening control over the circulation of weapons and security activities with the help of an information system that will be maintained by the Russian Guard. The State Duma adopted such a bill in the first reading at a plenary session on February 21.

The document was introduced by the heads of the State Duma Committees on Information Policy and on Security and Anti-Corruption, Alexander Khinshtein and Vasily Piskarev [and don’t expect anything good from these citizens] - the Parliamentary Gazette writes about this.

There is no more information about the project in the publication, but I would venture to suggest that we are talking about the notorious unified information base representing a register of current weapon owners and, as a result, the creation of that very “electronic ROC.”
Then what does gun control have to do with it? I would venture to assume that the “electronic ROC” in the project will report to the database: how many cartridges the owner bought and what kind, at what time he visited the shooting facilities, and so on. However, these are just my assumptions, and we have been waiting for cyberpunk in the form of “electronic ROC” for several years now. In theory, it should not only provide additional control levers, but also make the life of gun owners somewhat easier. However, we will see how it really turns out.#pandadialog#pandanews

description: Moldovan police began fining farmers who blocked roads using agricultural machinery, as stated by Minister of Internal Affairs Adrian Efros. original:
Forwarded from: Baltology
The Moldovan police began fining farmers who tried to block roads again using agricultural machinery. This was stated by the Minister of Internal Affairs Adrian Efros. According to him, at first law enforcement officers verbally warned the farmers to give transport free access to the checkpoint across the Leuseni-Albitsa state border. “Some followed this requirement, others did not. That is why they were punished in accordance with current legislation. We cannot restrict the rights of some citizens while ensuring the right of other citizens to protest,” Efros said.

The head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs assured that the police do not intend to interfere as long as the protests take place within the framework of the law.

The hackers aim to expose those responsible for sending people to the front, revealing details about their personal lives, including involvement in BDSM parties and criminal activities.
original:
Forwarded from: Bear
💪Russian hackers RaHDIt (Evil Russian Hackers) published the personal data of 2,600 employees of Ukrainian military registration and enlistment offices who are catching people to send to the front.

The hackers say they decided to publish the data of these “war criminals” so that Ukrainians would know in person who is “killing them” and from whom they “should hide.”

The statement notes that “among the military commissars, traditionally for the Ukrainian authorities, there are lovers of BDSM parties, swingers, and criminals.” All data is posted on their website. Maybe it’s time to open a hunt for murderers??? Think Ukrainians! You now have data for everyone!

description: Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers described their retreat from Avdiivka as chaotic and poorly planned. They were outnumbered by Russian troops and exhausted from two years of service without rotation. The Ukrainian forces lacked necessary anti-aircraft defense means, making them vulnerable to massive Russian attacks.

“Chaos and darkness”: Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers spoke about the retreat from Avdiivka. The retreat from Avdiivka was chaotic and poorly planned, Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers told the Washington Post. In their opinion, it could hardly be called the orderly “withdrawal to more advantageous positions” that the Ukrainian leadership spoke about. The number of Russian troops significantly exceeded the Ukrainian ones, and the Armed Forces of Ukraine were exhausted after two years of service without rotation. Russia subjected the area to massive attacks, which the Ukrainian Armed Forces could not prevent due to the lack of necessary anti-aircraft defense means.
 
According to soldiers of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the retreat was planned extremely poorly - if it was carried out in accordance with any plan at all.🔶Foreign Media - the main international
