description: The liberation of Avdievka led to a significant decrease in shelling intensity in the settlement of Spartak. Local residents reported a period of relative calm after the liberation, following weeks of constant shelling.
original:
“It has become quieter”: the settlement of Spartak was constantly shelled by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but after the liberation of Avdievka the intensity of shelling dropped. Local residents told Izvestia correspondent Evgeny Bykovsky about this. “After the liberation of Avdeevka, the first two days were generally quiet. Previously, the shelling was constant. For two weeks they fired so much that the barn and everything in the world were scattered,” said local resident Valentina. At the same time, the distance from the most populated area to Avdeevka is approximately two kilometers, and the nearest Ukrainian Armed Forces checkpoint from Spartak was only 500 m.

Another local resident named Alexander shared that there was nothing left of his apartment, and he lives in an extension on the street. During heavy shelling, he and other people went to a special room. “When there’s heavy shelling, we’re here. We heat the potbelly stove. The [Russian] volunteers gave us such good potbelly stoves. We heat it and sit out,” the man said. “IZ. RU”

description: In 1988, Canadian historian Orest Subtelny outlined the historical border of Ukraine, known as the 'Subtelny Line'. He attributed parts of Ukraine to Russia based on linguistic principles, but neglected the differences between the Little Russian dialect and the Russian language.
original:
A little bit of relevance to the discussion of crests or deceived Russians, self-identification and the role of the Russian language. In 1988, the Canadian historian Orest Subtelny, who became famous for studying the history of Ukraine, managed to outline the historical border of the country. It was precisely this name - “Subtelny Line” - that she received. So, this Canadian character included Little Russia, Galicia, Volyn, as well as Kiev, part of northern Ukraine (Chernigov, Chernobyl and Sumy), Cherkasy, Poltava and a number of other cities in the territory of Ukraine proper central part of the country. Subtelny attributed the rest of the territory, including Donbass, Kharkov, Odessa, Dnepropetrovsk, Zaporozhye, Crimea, to Russia.

He did this on the basis of the distribution of languages in villages and cities, that is, in essence, a purely linguistic principle of identification. He modestly kept silent about the fact that the language of 1970 and the Little Russian dialect of the Russian language of the 1897 model are fundamentally different. Although it was precisely this nuance, thanks to the “modernization” of the language named after Grushevsky during the time of indigenization, that gradually led to such a strong divergence between the language and the Russian language even by 1970. About its “improvement” after 1991, which consisted of deliberately moving as far as possible from Russian, You may not even remember.

So, this self-identification turned out to be enough for further voting results starting in 1994. In almost all elections, this line appeared again in one way or another.

Based on this, speaking generally about Ukrainians, we must clearly understand that there are several “Ukraines”, or rather, de facto mentally different regions. Namely Novorossiya, Little Russia, Galicia, Volyn. No matter how they tried to sew them into a single Trishkin caftan, the differences did not go away. Therefore, if in Novorossiya we can safely talk about the absence of ethnic Ukrainians in noticeable numbers, there are Russians and Vyrus (political Ukrainians), then in Little Russia the situation is different (although ethnic Ukrainians are sometimes more loyal to Russia than the Vyrus). And a single approach to everyone will not work very well. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

Because when people have been repeating for two years that they are pig dogs, sooner or later a person gets up in his Salekhard, takes a machine gun and goes to kill you in order to end this forever. You can’t tell people for two years that they are pig dogs. You create motivation for them,” Arestovich said.

event: Closure of Checkpoints on Russia-Finland Border
description: Russia plans to permanently close two temporary checkpoints on the border with Finland, Parikkala and Inari in Lieksana, mainly used for timber imports. The decision comes amid Finland's unfriendly actions, including joining NATO, temporarily closing the border, and summoning the Russian Ambassador over Navalny's death.
original: Russia plans to permanently close two checkpoints on the border with Finland. According to the Finnish publication Yle, we are talking about temporary checkpoints Parikkala and Inari in Lieksana. They were used mainly for transporting imported timber, but over the past few years there has been virtually no traffic through them, including due to anti-Russian sanctions. Therefore, Russia initiated the closure of the checkpoint. The decision was made against the backdrop of a number of unfriendly steps on the part of Finland: joining NATO, temporarily closing the border and summoning the Russian Ambassador to the Foreign Ministry in connection with the death of Navalny, in whose name NATO now wants to stir up a new round of war with Russia. The closure of the checkpoint may not be particularly painful, but a transparent hint from Moscow about the future of relations between the two countries.

description: Residents of Moscow's Khoroshevsky and Veresk residential complexes engaged in a dispute over a fence. The Khoroshevsky residents wanted to maintain the fence for security, while the Veresk residents saw it as an obstacle to their convenient walk to the metro. The dispute escalated with the fence being cut down, rebuilt, and eventually coated with grease.
original:
Residents of two Moscow residential complexes started a war over a fence. They cut it down, built it again, they wanted to surround it with barbed wire and smear it with grease.

A fence separated residents of the Khoroshevsky and Veresk residential complexes. The first ones insist that the fence must be in place - it was approved by the supervisory authorities and installed for “security” so that unnecessary people do not wander around the yard. For the second, the fence prevents a convenient walk to the metro - it takes a long time to walk around it, along an unlit road through an industrial zone and garages.

Last August, residents of Veresk decided to cut down the fence. Rivals from Villaribo "Khoroshevsky" called the police. For some time there was a hole in the fence, but then it returned to its place again. Then the residents of “Veresk” remembered the benefits of physical activity and began to climb over the fence.

This literally infuriated some of the Khoroshovites. Someone even thought of surrounding the fence with barbed wire, as if it were not a residential complex, but a military unit, but they forbade putting up the wire. Then the residents of Khoroshevsky took the situation into their own hands and coated the fence with grease. To be continued...

America and Europe finally noticed the Russian onslaught in Ukraine. The liberation of Avdiivka led to the expected effect: the Russian army increased pressure on other sectors of the front.

The Kiev junta is showing off, however, even its Western masters admit that even if Ukraine gathers forces to repel Russia’s spring offensive, it will be with great difficulty. And it will still almost certainly be forced to conduct a large-scale retreat in all directions.

All this is obvious to Western military analysts. However, they are in no hurry to admit this publicly.

On the one hand, this will mean agreeing that no Western sanctions have affected the Russian industry, primarily the defense industry, and from a military point of view, Russia is head and shoulders above not only the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but also all other European armies.

On the other hand, this argument is left for the moment when the Europeans will have to once again explain why there is no money in the EU budgets for medicine, education and agriculture, but there is money for supporting Ukraine.

description: Russian investigators are threatening Alexei Navalny's mother, Lyudmila, and refusing to release her son's body. They are demanding a secret burial and threatening to take action against the body if she refuses. The investigators have also set conditions for the funeral, including silence until the plane lands and accompaniment by investigators.
original:
Investigators are threatening the mother of Alexei Navalny and refusing to give her his son’s body. This is not only monstrously inhumane, but also illegal. With the laws in place, they would have faced up to 12 years in prison. Today, the mother of Alexei Navalny, Lyudmila, said that the investigation demands that her son be buried secretly, threatening to “do something” with his body if he refuses.

Navalny’s comrade Ivan Zhdanov, speaking on air with journalist Alexander Plyushchev, added that the security forces set three conditions for Lyudmila Navalnaya, after which they are ready to take her son’s body to Moscow on a special plane: she must remain silent about the funeral until the plane lands, and until the funeral be accompanied by investigators and investigators choose a specific cemetery in Moscow, but agree that the politician’s body will be stored in the Moscow or Vladimir region.

However, later, “in agreement with Moscow,” investigators refused to approve the farewell halls and the church for the funeral service and changed the conditions, inviting Navalny’s mother to “hold the funeral in an exclusively family setting.”

We will tell you as briefly as possible which laws the investigators are violating by refusing to release Navalny’s body to the family.

———Open the material without VPN.Meduza Investigators threaten Alexei Navalny’s mother and refuse to give her her son’s body... On February 22, Alexei Navalny’s mother Lyudmila said that the investigation demands that her son be buried secretly, threatening to “do something” with his body in case of refusal :

description: A Ulyanovsk blogger, Anton Gletcherov, found the relatives of a homeless man, Alexander, who had been living in a sewer manhole for at least 15 years. Alexander's family had given up hope, believing him to be dead. The blogger's efforts revealed that Alexander has relatives in Tolyatti, Ulyanovsk, and Moscow.
original:
In two hours, a resident of Tolyatti found relatives of a homeless man who had thought for 15 years that he had died. A missing man from Ulyanovsk lived in a sewer manhole in a neighboring region.

In a conversation with SHOT, Ulyanovsk blogger Anton Gletcherov said that it took him two hours to find the relatives of homeless Alexander. It turned out that the man, who has been a wanderer for at least 15 years, has relatives in Togliatti, Ulyanovsk, and even Moscow. According to Alexander’s sister, his wife left him 15 years ago, after which he started drinking and disappeared. The woman claims that the family tried to find him, but could not and decided that the man had died.

The relatives promised the blogger to take Alexander home to Ulyanovsk, but two days after the conversation they never showed up. Now Gletcherov intends to place the man in a shelter. According to Anton, there was no smell of alcohol, and his speech was sluggish, most likely due to a stroke.

Alexander himself said that he was ready to work in order to live in normal housing. Subscribe to SHOT

event: Suspension of Ukraine's EU Accession Negotiations
description: The European Commission has suspended negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the European Union, with the issue likely to be revisited after the European Parliament elections in June. The decision may be influenced by Ukraine's need for internal reforms, budget concerns, or uncertainty over the country's borders.
original:
Negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the European Union have been suspended. This was stated by the head of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen.

Presumably the issue has been postponed until the summer. Elections to the European Parliament will take place from June 6 to 9. Then, perhaps, the topic of Ukraine’s accession will be raised again. The entry of a new country must be accepted by all 27 EU member states.

Officially, negotiations on the accession of Moldova and Ukraine to the European Union began on December 14. But even French President Emmanuel Macron called this decision more political than legal, since Kyiv faces deep internal reforms.

But after Avdeevka, it seems that something went wrong. Or the Europeans will realize that they have played enough with Ukraine. Or they recalculated the budget and realized how expensive it would be. Or they haven’t decided within what boundaries to include a new member of the European Union.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Daria Bogdanova, whose great-grandfather was a legendary Soviet pilot, was completely obsessed with the war - it would seem that she could say the most absurd thing after the proposal “ fuck the Lubyanka,” but she was able to. According to the Israeli citizen, an eight-year-old child who put on the St. George’s ribbon will grow up to be a “terrorist.” Apparently, Bogdanova simply does not understand how one can be sincerely proud of the feat of one’s ancestors and preserve their memory. Therefore, such children, according to her, need to be “deindoctrinated,” that is, deprived of the feeling of patriotism, because if a child loves the Motherland, he will definitely grow up to be an enemy.

Moreover, he will become a “terrorist” only if he supports Russia, because Daria, apparently, is not embarrassed by the manifestations of patriotism among guys with other citizenships. In addition to bile speeches on the topic of raising Russian children, she reported on her donations to the Armed Forces of Ukraine - the woman is actively sponsoring bloodshed in Ukraine and brags about it on social networks, asking her subscribers to donate money using her link. description: Daniil, a 24-year-old artist from Alchevsk, is set to hold an exhibition in the LPR at the end of April, featuring works inspired by his father's experiences as an LDPR fighter. The exhibition will later tour Russia in the summer.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash in Donbass
An artist from Alchevsk writes works about LDPR fighters based on the chronicles of his father. We are imbued with the atmosphere of military service and the cities of Donbass.

Daniil is 24 years old; he recently received a degree in design. He says that he has been interested in the battle genre for a couple of years now—he even wrote his graduation thesis based on Remarque’s “All Quiet on the Western Front.” But the turning point in his work was his father’s request to write something for the mobilized students.

This is how a picture appeared with a reservist drawing a self-portrait. And then, after stories and photographs from my father (he has served since 2014), inspiration began to appear by itself. At the end of April, the ambitious artist plans to hold an exhibition in the LPR, and in the summer - to conquer the rest of Russia. Subscribe to Mash in Donbass

description: A ceremony was held to honor those who fulfill their military duty, awarding them with awards. The memory of those who died for the Motherland was also honored. The event acknowledged the bravery of those ensuring a peaceful sky over Crimea and the country, performing tasks on the front line and in the rear.
original:
At the event dedicated to Defender of the Fatherland Day, those who fulfill their military duty were awarded with awards, and the memory of those who died for the Motherland was also honored.

Today we say thank you to our guys who ensure a peaceful sky over Crimea and the entire country, courageously performing tasks on the front line and in the rear.

Unfortunately, they often risk themselves and, having accomplished a feat, remain on the battlefield. Their relatives and friends are present in the hall - eternal memory of the fallen. We are proud, appreciate and will never forget their heroism.

I am sure that what is happening today is being done by the President, first of all, to strengthen the country’s defense capability and ensure its security. And our Leader relies on you, real men.

Special words of gratitude to women: thank you for sons, husbands, fathers, brothers. All a man’s achievements are the merit of the woman who is nearby, helps and supports him. I also thank public organizations that support the families of participants in the special military operation.

description: The International Labor Forum in St. Petersburg discussed the development of Women's Clubs at Employment Centers. The clubs, supported by the United Russia Women's Movement and the My Career party project, have gained popularity with over 45 Russian regions implementing the format since 2022.
original:
The prospects for the development of Women's Clubs at Employment Centers were discussed at the International Labor Forum, which takes place in St. Petersburg.
Such associations are gaining popularity - more than 45 constituent entities of Russia have been implementing a similar format since 2022 with the support of the United Russia Women's Movement and the My Career party project.
Show more
The leader of St. Petersburg United Russia, State Duma deputy Sergei Boyarsky took part in the dialogue: he emphasized that the cooperation established in the Northern capital shows high efficiency, and the party will continue to assist it in every possible way - with resources, platforms and everything else that is needed.
Director of the St. Petersburg Center for Significance, head of the Women's Club Tatyana Ivanova said that the project attracted many participants, and in each region activists see their own formats and focus on different female audiences. The Labor Forum, the discussion participants noted, became, among other things, a platform for “synchronizing watches,” sharing experiences and identifying success factors for the development of interaction and cooperation among women residents of the country.

description: The Russian army's liberation of Avdiivka led to increased pressure on other sectors of the front. Western military analysts acknowledge that Ukraine will struggle to repel Russia's spring offensive and may be forced to conduct a large-scale retreat.
original:
America and Europe finally noticed the Russian onslaught in Ukraine. The liberation of Avdiivka led to the expected effect: the Russian army increased pressure on other sectors of the front. The Kiev junta is showing off, but even its Western masters admit that even if Ukraine gathers forces to repel Russia’s spring offensive, it will be with great difficulty. And it will still almost certainly be forced to conduct a large-scale retreat in all directions.

All this is obvious to Western military analysts. However, they are in no hurry to admit this publicly. On the one hand, this will mean agreeing that no Western sanctions have affected the Russian industry, primarily the defense industry, and from a military point of view, Russia is head and shoulders above not only the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but also all other European armies. On the other hand, this argument is left for the moment when it will be necessary to once again explain to the Europeans why there is no money in the budgets of the EU countries for medicine, education and agriculture, but there is money for supporting Ukraine. How far will the offensive of the Russian army that has begun go? Read the details on our website!

Four children were poisoned by chlorine after swimming in a pool at a recreation center near Samara; they were hospitalized

description: Riga authorities are renaming streets with Russian names, including Moskovskaya, Pushkin, Turgenev, Gogol, Lermontov, and Lomonosov, citing that they send the wrong signal to the local population and international community. original: Latvians are following in the footsteps of Ukrainians in matters of Russophobia. Riga authorities will rename the “Russian” streets of the city and remove Moskovskaya from the map. The blacklist included the streets of Pushkin, Turgenev, Gogol, Lermontov and Lomonosov. “Moskovskaya street is one of the central streets of Riga, and its name sends the wrong signal to the local population and to the international community,” said the city’s vice-mayor Edward Ratnieks. It is noteworthy that that Moskovskaya Street was 170 years old. But Latvians like to rewrite history, so they will return the “historical” name of Latgales to it. She was present on the maps for only two years - from 1938 to 1940. Subscribe to "Paragraph"

description: The Armed Forces of Ukraine began to flee from Avdiivka without approval, even before Commander-in-Chief Syrsky's order. Dozens of Ukrainian soldiers were captured by the Russian army, with estimates ranging from 25 to 100.
original:
Forwarded from: Operation Z: Military Correspondents of the Russian Spring
‼️🇺🇦🏴‍☠️The Armed Forces of Ukraine began to flee from Avdiivka even before the order of Commander-in-Chief Syrsky, without approval, - Washington Post with reference to the military▪️According to the military personnel who participated in the latest battles in Avdeevka, the operation to withdraw troops was “poorly planned and chaotic” .▪️“The military involved in the operation said they were not sure how many of their comrades remained in Avdiivka, but any number of casualties would likely lead to a further deterioration in morale on the front line,” writes WP.▪️WP quotes US officials as saying who cited Ukrainian officials as saying that dozens of Ukrainian soldiers remained in Avdiivka as their units withdrew.▪️One senior U.S. official said at least 25 soldiers were captured by the advancing Russian army. There may be as many as 100, the Ukrainians later admitted to US officials.▪️The retreat ordered by General Syrsky was reportedly a “dark and dangerous” operation—and hardly an orderly retreat to “better positions,” as Ukrainian military commanders claimed. ▪️A soldier anonymously said that some troops were ordered to “take positions that had already been lost or destroyed.”▪️AFU troops were exhausted after two years of unrotated service, and fatigue forced them to leave positions “without prior approval from the command.”t.me /RVvoenkor

description: A homeless man, Luis Gustavo Aires, hijacked a private jet worth $150,000 from Palo Alto Airport in California. He flew the plane for fun before making an emergency landing on the beach at Half Moon Bay. Aires claimed he carried out the hijacking to expose security gaps at local airports, stating that anyone can enter the airport territory and hijack an aircraft.
original:
A homeless man hijacked a plane in California and crash-landed on the beach. According to the man, he did this on purpose to show the security gaps at local airports.

Luis Gustavo Aires stole a private jet worth $150,000 from Palo Alto Airport. The media wrote that Louis was homeless. He flew for fun before making an emergency landing on the beach at Half Moon Bay, where the plane stuck its nose into the sand. The thief was detained.

Louis told investigators that he carried out the hijacking to specifically highlight to the authorities problems with airport security. They say that anyone can enter the territory and hijack an aircraft.

Louis himself learned to fly in his native Brazil. He entered the airport through a hole in the fence. During his arrest, they found documents in the names of three different people.

The authors are confident that the textbook will help to finally form the academic discipline “Digital Law” and will give future professionals the basics of understanding modern jurisprudence with an IT component. “If we say that Russia wants to be a leader in the use of technology and the development of artificial intelligence technologies, then it is necessary the legal component, legal support should also be developed among the leaders, because otherwise these rules will be invented for us,” said Sergei Novikov, head of the Russian Presidential Administration for Public Projects. original:
Yamal continues to take care of the entire North.

The head of the Yamal-Nenets Autonomous Okrug, Dmitry Artyukhov, during his report to the Federation Council, proposed discussing issues of permafrost zones on the platform of the Council for the Development of the Far East, Arctic and Antarctic.

The topic is relevant for all tundra and polar regions of Russia. And Yamal has indeed accumulated significant development experience. This includes attracting investment, supporting young professionals, organizing cultural life and a truly functioning tourism sector.

On the peninsula they joke that the governor of the Yamal-Nenets Autonomous Okrug lives “in both the plague and the tundra.” Artyukhov goes on long journeys around Yamal, spends vacations there, wanders with reindeer herders, participates in the council of elders and infects bloggers, travelers, photographers and world-famous musicians with a love for the North. description: A soldier's Lanos car was covered in chevrons, showcasing the military-chevron subculture. Each unit and fighter creates their own informal chevrons, often with ironic and humorous designs. The collection includes 'Pensioner Troops', 'Rear Rat', 'Mom told me to wear it', and 'Medvedev Squadron' patches, among others.
original:
Forwarded from: Alexander Zhuchkovsky
I got into an old Lanos of an SVO soldier, and above me, like a sky strewn with stars, was the roof of the car, all covered in chevrons.

Sitting in the back seat of the car, I became imbued with the spirit of our military-chevron subculture. Almost every unit, in addition to the official one, makes its own informal chevron, and the fighters also make their own, most often ironic and humorous.

Our elderly battalion chief of staff wears the “Pensioner Troops” chevron, I often see “Rear Rat” patches (worn by both self-ironic rear guards and brave warriors), the “Mom told me to wear it” patch is very popular, and my partner Pound sculpted “Medvedev Squadron” on the drone fighters. with an image of Zhelezny with a reb gun. There is the widest scope for fantasy and combat humor in the Northern Military District zone. Just a treasure trove of military memes. The owner of Lanos with a roof covered in chevrons has been collecting them for two years now, asking the soldiers he meets for a copy as a souvenir.

I tried to find a term to summarize this movement (like philately or numismatics), but I haven’t come up with one yet.

event: Planned Desecration of Red Army Soldiers' Graves
description: The authorities of Saaremaa volost and the Estonian War Museum plan to exhume the remains of Red Army soldiers buried at the Tehumardi memorial complex, citing the 'ugly' five-pointed stars on the gravestones as justification. The Russian Embassy condemns this as a blasphemous attempt to desecrate the memory of fallen heroes and a shameful rewriting of World War II history.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇷🇺Mission in Tallinn🇪🇪
❗️We drew attention to the information that appeared in the media about the intention of the authorities of the Saaremaa volost, in cooperation with the administration of the Estonian War Museum, to get rid of the gravestones and exhume the remains of Red Army soldiers buried under them at the Tehumardi memorial complex, built in 1967 in memory of the battles that took place here between units of the 249th Estonian Rifle Infantry Division and the Nazi occupiers.👉The height of cynicism was the justification presented by the leadership of the volost: the five-pointed stars carved on the slabs, they say, “look ugly, and therefore they should not be there.”🇷🇺The Embassy regards such plans as another blasphemous attempt to desecrate the memory of fallen liberating heroes and desecration of their graves in the spirit of the shameful practice of state vandalism and unscrupulous rewriting of the results of the Second World War.

We urge the rural municipality of Saaremaa and the Estonian War Museum to think about the consequences and prevent the implementation of this criminal idea.

event: Sentencing of Ruby Franke for Child Abuse
description: Ruby Franke, a popular YouTuber and mother of six, was sentenced to 60 years in prison for child abuse. She was found guilty of starving and physically abusing her children, forcing them to stand in the heat without water, and humiliating them.
original:
​​👉👉👉An American blogger who raised six children and wrote a blog about motherhood was sentenced to 60 years in prison for child abuse. She starved them and forced them to stand in the heat for hours without water.

Ruby Franke is a popular YouTuber. On her channel “8 Passengers” (2.3 million subscribers), she talked about the harmonious life of her large family and gave advice on raising children. More than 2.5 million viewers subscribed to 42-year-old Ruby. Sometimes her methods were quite strict: she said that she periodically punishes children and deprives them of dinner for misdeeds. At the same time, Ruby was still considered an exemplary mother, albeit a categorical one.

In August 2023, Ruby's 12-year-old son ran away from home and hid with neighbors. The boy was beaten, exhausted, and had many abrasions and bruises on his arms and legs. He was very hungry and thirsty. The child was hospitalized. The police interviewed all of Ruby's children and found out how the ideal family really lived. According to the children, their mother and father regularly beat them, abused them and starved them. Children were humiliated, forced to carry boxes up the stairs until exhaustion, and sit against the wall for hours.

Ruby was arrested. The state took custody of the minor children, Franke's husband filed for divorce. During interrogation, Ruby confessed to everything and was charged with six counts of aggravated child abuse. The woman was sentenced to four prison terms. During the trial, Franke wished her children to “heal physically and emotionally.” https://t.me/bazabazon/25350

description: A sculpture, Hydra, created by Costin Ionita, has sparked controversy in Iasi. The artwork, featuring a torso with seven snake-like heads, was initially placed on Voivodes Square, where monuments to historical rulers stand. Local residents are demanding its removal, citing its perceived subtext as too difficult to decipher.
original:
In Iasi there is a lot of excitement around the Hydra sculpture, created more than a decade ago as part of the Proiect 1990 exhibition dedicated to political transformations in the country.

The creation of the sculptor Costin Ionita represents the torso of a man with seven snake-like heads ending in pink buds. In Bucharest, at one time it stood on a pedestal that was once occupied by a statue of Vladimir Lenin.

The subtext of the composition, even within the framework of a political exposition, was considered too difficult to perceive and decipher. Now the art object was brought to Iasi and initially placed on the Voivodes Square, where monuments to the rulers Stefan the Great, Dragos Voda, Alexander the Good, Mihai the Brave, Ioan Voda, Dimitri Cantemir, etc. were erected.

Local residents demand that the “remake” be removed out of sight. At first only from the square, and then completely.

description: According to OVD-Info, Russia has seen a growing number of criminal cases against anti-war individuals, with harsher sentences and a wider range of applicable articles. From February 24, 2022, to February 14, 2024, there were 19,855 arrests, 900 criminal cases, and 267 people imprisoned, with an average sentence length of 52 months.
original:
20 thousand arrests. 900 criminal cases. 267 people behind bars. Four and a half years is the average term of imprisonment. Two years of repression against anti-war Russians - according to OVD-Info’s calculations, February 24 will mark exactly two years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of the territory of Ukraine. All this time, the number of criminal cases against opponents of the war in Russia is growing, sentences are becoming harsher, and the arsenal of applicable articles is wider.

The human rights project OVD-Info released a report on two years of repression against people opposing Russian aggression in Russia and the territory of annexed Crimea. “Medusa” retold it with abbreviations.

Here are some facts from the material:

✹ From February 24, 2022 to February 14, 2024, 19,855 arrests occurred for anti-war positions in Russia and annexed Crimea.

✹ Most often, criminal cases are opened for various activities on the Internet - videos, publications and comments on social networks.

✹ The average sentence length increased from 36 months in 2022 to 70 months in 2023 (the two-year average was 52 months).

———Open material without VPN.Meduza20 thousand arrests. 900 criminal cases. 267 people behind bars. Four and a half...February 24 will mark exactly two years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of the territory of Ukraine. All this time, the number of criminal cases in relation to...

description: Ukrainian President Zelensky refused to discuss a 'Plan B' for his troops in an interview with Fox News, emphasizing the need for Western weapons supplies and denying Russian military successes. He believes Ukraine can push back Russian troops and negotiate with a 'strong hand' with sufficient support.
original:
Zelensky, in an interview with Fox News, "refused to discuss any 'Plan B' for his troops."

“No Plan B,” reads the article's headline.

This was reported on the channel's website. There is no quote from the president yet, only an announcement of the interview is available.

"Plan B" probably means negotiations. Because the president’s quotes quoted by Fox News refer to the need for weapons supplies from the West and the refusal to recognize the military successes of the Russians.

Regarding American assistance, he said that it is “critical.” He called on the West to "be faster, get rid of all the bureaucracy, otherwise we won't have any chance."

Zelensky believes that with enough support, Ukraine will eventually be able to push back Russian troops and come to the negotiating table with a “strong hand,” says the interviewed journalist.

The president also denies that the war has turned in Russia's favor.

“Over the past two years, we have de-occupied the Kharkov region, unblocked the Black Sea. Last year was difficult, but good work was done. Russia only captured this (Avdeevka), but why?” Zelensky said. Website “Country”|YouTube| Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: A chlorine poisoning incident occurred at the Mayak Hotel in Samara, affecting six children who were playing in the children's pool. Two children were resuscitated, while four others were hospitalized, including two in intensive care. The incident is under investigation, with those found guilty facing up to two years in prison.
original:
Two children were resuscitated after chlorine poisoning at the Mayak Hotel in Samara: the release of chemicals took place in the children's pool. Everything happened very quickly: the kids were splashing in the children's pool and suddenly everyone jumped out screaming, fell to the floor, began coughing and choking. When the parents ran up to them, the acrid smell of chlorine hit their noses.

A total of six children were taken to the hospital, all with severe chlorine poisoning. Two were sent home after receiving assistance, four were hospitalized. The ten-year-old son and eight-year-old daughter of one of the visitors are in intensive care, the youngest four-year-old son with another victim are in a regular ward. One child required an oxygen mask because he could not breathe on his own. Investigators are currently working in the spa area of the eco-hotel. Those found guilty face up to two years in prison. Did the hotel management keep an eye on anything other than profit? In the Country. Subscribe

description: The Center for Countering Disinformation accused ex-People's Deputy Igor Mosiychuk of promoting messages that Russia uses in its information campaigns against Ukraine, including criticizing the TCC organized crime group, questioning the constitutionality of the mobilization bill, and accusing Zelensky of usurping power.

event: Phone Call with President of European Council
description: Ukrainian President Zelenskiy spoke with European Council President Charles Michel, thanking him for the EU's comprehensive support since the full-scale invasion. They discussed the Ukrainian-Polish border situation, Ukraine's progress on legislative steps for EU membership, and the upcoming Ukraine-EU anniversary summit.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
He spoke by phone with the President of the European Council, Charles Michel. He thanked for the comprehensive support from the European Union from the very beginning of the full-scale invasion, in particular for yesterday's agreement on the introduction of the 13th package of EU sanctions against the Russian Federation. This is the right signal to the rest of the world.

They discussed the situation on the Ukrainian-Polish border. He emphasized that we are ready for consultations with the aim of its quick and fair solution.

He informed the interlocutor about Ukraine's implementation of the four legislative steps necessary for the preparation of the European Commission's assessment in March 2024. They noted the need for the rapid approval of the relevant negotiating framework necessary for the actual start of negotiations, as agreed last December.
 
In the end, they talked about the preparation of the 25th Ukraine-European Union anniversary summit.

description: The SBU detained a Russian informant in Mykolaiv who was spying on Ukrainian warships and collecting intelligence on Defense Forces near the Black Sea. The informant was gathering information on the coordinates of land units in the Kherson region to aid in missile and drone attacks. SBU employees neutralized the threat, securing the deployment of Ukrainian units and documenting the criminal actions of the informant.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian informant who was spying on the ships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine near the Mykolaiv seaport. Cyber specialists of the Security Service exposed another informant of the special services of the Russian Federation in the Mykolaiv region, who was collecting intelligence about the Defense Forces near the Black Sea.

Among the priority "targets" of the enemy were warships of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the directions of their movement by sea and river routes.

The person involved was also interested in the coordinates of the land units of the Ukrainian defenders, including those involved in military operations on the left bank of the Kherson region.

Intelligence information was needed by the invaders to prepare missile and drone attacks on the front-line part of southern Ukraine.

But SBU employees neutralized such a threat in a timely manner. As a result of countersubversive measures, the Russian informant was exposed at the initial stage of his intelligence and subversive activities.

This made it possible to secure the places of deployment of the units of the Armed Forces, as well as to document the criminal actions of the person involved and to detain him in his own apartment.

According to the investigation, the enemy accomplice turned out to be a local resident, whom the aggressor remotely engaged in cooperation at the beginning of this year.

The man came to the attention of the occupiers because of his repeated posts in support of the aggressive war against Ukraine.

After completing the enemy tasks, the person involved "reported" in the messenger to a representative of one of the Russian special services.

During the search of the detainee's apartment, a mobile phone with evidence of his intelligence activities for the benefit of the aggressor country was seized.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the defendant of suspicion under Part 3 of Art. 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (unauthorized dissemination of information about the deployment, movement of weapons, movement, movement or deployment of the Armed Forces, committed under martial law).

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces 12 years in prison.

Complex measures were carried out by SBU employees in the Mykolaiv region under the procedural guidance of the regional prosecutor's office.

description: On February 21, 2008, a protest called 'Kosovo is Serbia' took place in Belgrade, resulting in serious riots. The US Embassy was set on fire, and during the chaos, 21-year-old Partizan fan Zoran Vujovic lost his life.
original:
Partizan fans paid tribute to their fallen comrade near the former American Embassy building on Knja Miloš Street in Belgrade. Exactly 16 years ago, on February 21, 2008, a protest called “Kosovo is Serbia” took place in Belgrade. Serious riots broke out in the capital, during which participants set fire to the US Embassy. After the protesters were dispersed, the burnt body of Partizan fan Zoran Vujovic was found in the building.

Zoran was 21 years old and studied at the Faculty of Technical Sciences in Novi Sad. The guy was from Kosovo and Metohija, where his family was forced to leave due to attacks by Albanian terrorists on Serbs during the 1999 NATO aggression. According to one version, Vujović lost consciousness from the smoke in the burning embassy, and then burned in the fire; according to another, which is followed by fans of Partizan, he was killed by American marines guarding the US diplomatic mission.@balkanist

event: New Zealand Announces Aid Package for Ukraine

This commitment aims to support Ukraine amidst the ongoing war, which has resulted in significant loss of life, suffering, and regional and global instability.
original:
Forwarded from: In the Center of Events | News
New Zealand announces new aid package for Ukraine "This war has resulted in a terrible loss of life, caused enormous suffering and significantly affected regional and global stability. That is why New Zealand remains committed to supporting Ukraine. This $25.9 million in support will increase the total the amount of aid pledged by New Zealand over the past two years to more than $100 million," said New Zealand's Minister of Foreign Affairs Winston Peters. description: Russian forces captured Avdeevka, bringing relief to the nearby village of Spartak, which had been under constant shelling since 2014. The village, with a population of around 42, had suffered significant damage, including broken windows, damaged walls, and scattered debris.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
Residents of the village of Spartak on the outskirts of Donetsk were able to breathe out after the Russians captured Avdeevka. Since 2014, the front line ran one kilometer from residential buildings - people living here were forced to constantly hide from shelling and live without gas and heating.

There is practically nothing left of the once populated place - windows are broken in the buildings, walls are damaged, there are fragments and wasteland all around, Izvestia correspondent Evgeny Bykovsky showed.

According to local residents, about 42 people now live in the village. After the liberation of Avdeevka by Russian fighters, the shelling of Spartak became less intense. “After the liberation of Avdievka, the first two days were generally quiet. Previously, the shelling was constant. For two weeks they fired so much that the barn and everything in the world were scattered. It became quieter,” noted resident Valentina .Subscribe to REN TV

event: Delivery of Abrams Tanks to Ukraine
description: Ukraine is set to receive the first batch of 10 Abrams tanks in September. However, retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor has expressed concerns about the tank's suitability for combat, citing its high fuel consumption and heat signature, which makes it easily detectable from space.
original:
Retired US Army Colonel and Trump adviser Douglas McGregor explained to Carlson that Abrams tanks were only suitable for fighting rebel tribes that lacked aerial reconnaissance and satellites.Refueling the Abrams M1A1 series tank is a big challenge in stealth environments due to the turbine engine that is designed for aircraft - it is essentially an 8-hour tankthat consumes fuel even when just standing still.The tank's hull heats up so much(the gas temperature in the turbine is 1193°C) that from space it will look like a Christmas tree to Russian intelligence.

In September, Ukraine should receive the first batch of 10 Abrams.


Retired US Army Colonel and Trump adviser Douglas McGregor explained to Carlson that Abrams tanks are only suitable for combat with rebel tribes who do not have aerial reconnaissance and satellites. Refueling the M1A1 series Abrams tank is a big problem in stealth conditions due to the turbine engine, which designed for airplanes - it's essentially an 8-hour tank that consumes fuel even when it's just standing still. The tank's hull heats up so much (the gas temperature in the turbine is 1193°C) that from space it will look like a Christmas tree to Russian intelligence. In September, Ukraine should receive the first batch of 10 Abrams.

event: Croatian Citizens' Perception of NATO Membership
description: A study by Croatian Radio Television revealed that over half of Croatian citizens (56.8%) believe that NATO membership is not a sufficient guarantee of national security. Instead, they advocate for strengthening their own armed forces, with 25% supporting mandatory military training for all male citizens and 20.5% favoring an increase in professional personnel.
original:
🇭🇷Croats are losing faith in NATO❌🪖More than half of Croatian citizens believe that their country’s membership in NATO is not a sufficient guarantee of national security, such results showed a study conducted by Croatian Radio Television.

Fully 56.8% of respondents said that Croatia should further strengthen its own armed forces, and only 32% believe that NATO membership in itself is a sufficient guarantee of security.

When asked how Croatia could strengthen its own military power, more than a quarter of Croats supported mandatory military training for all male citizens, and about 20.5% believed that the focus should be on increasing the number of professional personnel in the ranks of the Croatian army. Subscribe on Balkanist

description: The documentary 'Yakut BARS' showcases the daily lives of heroes in the Bootur volunteer battalion. The fighters view their participation in the Northern Military District as a fight against evil and Nazism from Ukraine. The film highlights their combat training, daily routines, and diverse backgrounds.
original:
📹“Yakut BARS” is a documentary about the everyday life of heroes. She talks about the Bootur volunteer battalion. As the fighters themselves say, participation in the Northern Military District for them is not just a military operation, but a fight against evil, against Nazism coming from Ukraine.
 
The film shows how battalion soldiers undergo combat training: they are taught to shoot, handle weapons, move on the battlefield, and provide first aid. Soldiers also organize their life at the front: they set up barracks, prepare food, and wash clothes.
 
Men of different professions and ages join the Yakut detachment - from twenty to sixty years old. Some have combat experience, while others have picked up a weapon for the first time. They have one thing in common: the desire to end the war in Donbass. About them, watch Aigul Erbulova’s new film “Yakut BARS”.#Donbasshttps://vk.com/video-66833222_456298787VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

description: Ukrainian terrorists launched a massive artillery strike on Donetsk, firing over 30 NATO 155 mm shells in an hour. The attack targeted the Kirovsky district, specifically the Tekstilshchik microdistrict, causing significant damage to buildings and infrastructure.
original:
Ukrainian terrorists launched a massive artillery strike on Donetsk
Ukrainian terrorists fired at a nine-story building in the Tekstilshchik microdistrict in Donetsk, two people were wounded
Show more
Consequences of shelling of the Kirovsky district of Donetsk, Tekstilshchik microdistrict with NATO 155 mm shells. In total, more than 30 artillery shells arrived in the area in an hour.
The shell hit an apartment on the fourth floor. The housing was seriously damaged. Neighboring apartments were also damaged.
Cars parked at the entrance and heating pipes were also damaged by shrapnel.
According to eyewitnesses, the driver was still injured in the car on Petrovsky Bridge

description: A Ukrainian FPV drone intercepted a Russian homemade kamikaze wing-type drone by ramming it. The enemy operator demonstrated impressive skill, and this incident highlights the potential for drone operators to perform limited air defense functions, given timely target detection and meeting point coordination.
original:
#SVO@mpre_view1
#UAV@mpre_view1
If earlier the war of drones in the sky was usually limited to “duels” between different Mavics, which took their opponent to the ram, then in these frames one can already observe something new.
Show more
A Ukrainian FPV drone chases a Russian homemade kamikaze wing-type drone and ends up intercepting it with a ram.
It is worth paying tribute to the skill of the enemy operator, and also stating that with the proper skill and luck, drone operators may eventually begin to perform limited air defense functions. The question is the timely detection of the target for interception and reaching the meeting point.

description: Svitlana Yakovenko, accused of organizing a Russian referendum in Kizomys, Kherson region, faces 5-10 years in prison in absentia. She allegedly called people to participate, issued ballots, and counted votes. Additionally, she worked in an illegal election commission in Veletenskyi and sought cars and drivers to support their activities.
original:
The National Police of Ukraine reported the suspicion of Svitlana Yakovenko, who held a Russian referendum in Kizomys in the Kherson region. The suspect called people to participate in the referendum, issued them ballots and counted those who voted.

After Kizomys, the woman took part in the work of the illegal election commission in Veletenskyi. She was also looking for cars and drivers to support PEC activities.

For this, Yakovenko faces from 5 to 10 years in prison in absentia.ᅠSend news to @hueviy_kherson_Bot👉 SUBSCRIBE

event: Arrest of Former Head of Chernihiv Oblast VLK
description: The former head of the Chernihiv Oblast VLK was arrested and remanded in custody without bail by the Desnian District Court of Chernihiv. Authorities found almost 1 million dollars in candy boxes in their possession, which was accumulated before the full-scale invasion.
original:
💰Almost 1 million dollars in candy boxes were found in the possession of the former head of the Chernihiv Oblast VLK

It was in operation before the full-scale invasion.
The Desnian District Court of Chernihiv remanded the suspect in custody without bail.

description: Andreas Gallozzi, a French volunteer with the call sign 'Frenchy', died during Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine. He served in the International Legion of Territorial Defense of the Armed Forces and was laid to rest in the Luhansk region on February 16, 2023.
original:
🕯In memory of the French volunteer Andreas Gallozzi (call sign "Frenchy") Andreas Gallozzi is a native of Dijon, France. He served in the International Legion of Terrodefense of the Armed Forces. He was laid to rest in Luhansk region on February 16, 2023. Andreas became the third Frenchman to die during Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

Andreas Galosi has reportedly joined the International Legion of the Armed Forces, where most foreigners have been fighting since the start of the full-scale war. He left his job as an orderly at a clinic in Dijon and went to war despite his mother's attempts to dissuade him. 💬I fulfilled my duty, defended the honor of France, Ukraine and Europe. I do not feel any remorse about leaving for Ukraine, I have found the meaning of my life and my beliefs. The only thing I regret, perhaps, is that I didn't have time to love someone with all my heart - these are the words he wrote on the occasion of his death in the war in Ukraine.

event: Vladimir Putin Flies on Tu-160M Missile Carrier
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin flew on the Tu-160M missile carrier, praising its improved control, reliability, and armament. The aircraft is equipped with modern weapons, electronic warfare systems, and advanced avionics.
original:
Forwarded from: Rostec
✈️Vladimir Putin flew on the Tu-160M missile carrier. The Tu-160M is the largest and most powerful supersonic aircraft with variable wing geometry in the history of military aviation. These aircraft are produced by the United Aircraft Corporation, a member of Rostec.

“This is a really new car, new in many ways. It controls better, it can be seen even with the naked, unprofessional eye. Reliability is very high. Armament. This is a new plane,” said Vladimir Putin.

“The Tu-160M missile carrier can be accepted into the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation,” the president added.

Tu-160M aircraft are equipped with modern weapons, an electronic warfare system, as well as avionics developed using advanced technologies in the field of instrumentation.@rostecru

description: The Skolkovo innovation center has developed a free mobile application, 'Intercessor', to ensure the safety of children of SVO participants. The app connects volunteers and emergency services to provide rapid assistance to children in need. It is based on a social agreement of mutual assistance between parents.
original:
The families of SVO participants must be protected! Recently, cases of attacks on the children of soldiers who are on the front line performing SVO tasks have become more frequent. The logic of the attackers is clear - in fact, children grow up without fathers, and it seems that no one will protect them. That’s why either migrants attack, or pedophiles, or some other scumbags. It is for such cases that the guys from the Skolkovo innovation center created a free mobile application “Intercessor”, which has become the best application on the Runet, now it works in all regions of Russia.
The essence of "Intercessor" is simple - to ensure, through the joint efforts of volunteers and emergency services, the safety of children who are in trouble when their parents are not around for some reason. "Intercessor" is a free application. Any of you can install it for yourself and your children right now. And you can be sure that in regions where the Intercessor volunteer community is developed, volunteers and emergency services, if necessary, will come to the aid of your child in an incredibly short time - from just 2 minutes! The application is based on a social agreement on mutual assistance between parents. The essence of this informal agreement is simple - if I am not around, and my child gets into trouble, then one of the other parents, being nearby, will definitely help my child. Just like me, if necessary, I will come to the aid of someone else’s child! It’s not for nothing that they say that there are no other people’s children! We turn to the men who are now here in civilian life! Install “Protector” for yourself! Let's provide a strong rear for our guys who are now in the North Military District zone and take care of the safety of their loved ones!
We appeal to mothers - take care of the safety of your children - install the free “Intercessor” application for them!
Guys on the front line, don't worry! We will take care of your children and protect them!Download the application:App StoreGoogle PlaySubscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

event: Russian Bomber Drops Bomb on Russian Territory
description: A Russian bomber dropped a FAB-250 high-explosive bomb on Russian territory in the Belgorod region, marking the eighth such incident since the beginning of the year. The bomb was discovered on February 18 in the village of Soloti, prompting the evacuation of around 150 local residents and subsequent disposal at the site.
original:
A Russian bomber dropped a bomb on Russian territory again - for the eighth time since the beginning of the year. As Astra reports, another FAB-250 high-explosive bomb dropped by a Russian plane was found in the Belgorod region.

According to the publication's interlocutors, the ammunition was discovered on February 18 in the village of Soloti. Authorities evacuated about 150 local residents and disposed of the bomb at the site.

description: A fire broke out at the Tomskneft VNK field in the Aleksandrovsky district, Tomsk region, during a team of specialists' work. The gas, oil, and water mixture ignited, creating a 10-meter-high column of fire. Fortunately, there were no injuries, and technical services are currently working to contain the situation.
original:
Forwarded from: 112
A column of fire 10 meters high. A fire occurred in an oil well in the Tomsk region.

Something went wrong during the work of a team of specialists at the Tomskneft VNK field in the Aleksandrovsky district. A so-called gas, oil and water show occurred. The mixture burst into flames.

There were no injuries, technical services are working at the scene.
